number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								First, this game has a lot of promise. I hope that the devs are dedicated to see it through to its full potential. Overall, the game has a very good feel to it.I don't have any major complaints for this game that, at this point as an Early Access game, would be a dealbreaker and they're mostly asthetic complaints--the way that buildings sit on hills, etc; these are things that can be, and I'm sure will be, fixed easily.The minor complaints: * Hunger also seems to progress quickly, although I haven't tried to quantify it in any meaningful way; I shouldn't have to eat several pieces of meat during the night to stay alive, and* I shouldn't be in a perpetual quest for more cotton, which seems very scarce but very needed for bandages and cloth strips, and many times I will find a cotton bush only to have it drop zero cotton.Things that would be nice going forward:  * Being able to sleep part of the night away, say if you're full of food and in good health, * More content, * More monsters, * More crafting items, and * More building items such as walls, pike torches for some visual security at night, etc.

content:

Early Access Review
								Joining a Hostile-mode server, loading screen, loading still in progress when I get killed loosing all my items. Yes, you can get killed while staring at the loading screen.Joining a Friendly-mode server, 1 minute there, BAN. Happened to me twice. Probably they did not like my naked willy dangling between my legs. Yes, your character starts completely naked.More cons:- game looks very cheap graphics-wise. UI wise, music-wise, everything-wise.- it lacks any atmosphere, e.g. feeling of cold in Kholat game is intense. Here it is not- most creatures die after one or two hits and are not very dangerous. But - there is no animation of creatures attacking you, they are only running hence and forth, even disappearing and reappearing sometimes. You only hear a sound meaning you got wounded and you hear it with a delay of 1 second or so. Wonderful.- the video on Steam store page is well made, the game isn't. Do not get deceived by it

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								As of 5-1-2016: Clunky clunky as H-E-Double-Hockey-Sticks. Get past that and you'll find something VERY satisfying. I'm giving this a positive review so I'll start with the cons. Let me start off by saying I was playing PVE and opened my server to multiplayer for anyone to join. Cons:* Overall SERIOUS lack of polish. (but I played it when it first launched in EA... Now, a few months later I don't even recognize the game it's so much better.)* Clunky controls (however, WASD is present. Keys arent clunky, the feel is.)* No Female avatar (thus my wife doesn't want to play)Pros* Survival FEELS like surviving.* This is the ONLY Survival game where I felt "Home" meant something. Where I was HAPPY to sit by MY fire.* Gathering is pretty satisfying.* Items don't de-spawn if dropped on ground (in other games I wouldn't care, but in early game, space is SERIOUSLY limited.* Monsters can be REALLY dangerous. (Something lacking in most survival PVE)This brings me to my last Pro, which deserves a catatgory of its own.Two time's I've played. Months ago and now. BOTH times I met AWESOME person after AWESOME person. Everyone I met was SO generous. They would pop in, toss down a bunch of stuff, warm themself by my fire for a while, chatting... and then leave.If the community manages to stay this pleasant this game MAY become the "PVEer's Survival game".10/10 Would chat by the fire again.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								I read alot of the reviews before buying this. Slow and buggy I expect, and certainly don't mind it being part of the experience of playing an early access game. The only thing that lets this down in my opinion, and is the sole reason of 2 extremely frustrated and premature game session endings is that bloody dragon! Fair enough I expected Savage - but why have a mob, that you can't really outrun or fight against right at the begining that likes to pop off it's perch every few minuntes and fry you? You get a heatbeat or two of warning (if you're lucky) with the sound of its wings before being engulfed in flames! If it was every now and again I could accept it's part of the feel of the game to constantly be afraid, but the fact its every 5-6 minutes and nearly all but a few times ends in a death just makes the playing experience entirely unenjoyable. Of the few hours played I've died over a dozen times becuase of the dragon. The one and only time I didnt die becuase of the dragon was from a wolf, which joined in the chase as I was running around a big rock away from the bloody dragon!! I loved the concept of this game and really, really wanted to spend hours enjoying it. I like difficult, I expected far less help  and hand holding than the game actually gives. I enjoy long resource gathering and working towards building something that took alot of effort. What I really don't enjoy and makes the game unplayable for me is the fact its effectively time barring your character to a set few minutes before certain death, respawn, run back to corpse to get gear, crack on for another few minutes before certain death! That's just not enjoyable! Maybe I'm being harsh and I've missed something? Maybe if I stuck at it through another dozen deaths to build something than doesn't burn that I could run into until the dragon gets bored? Maybe a bit further on, or alot more practice with a bow and arrow would rid me of the sodding dragon? But do I want to continue through that frustration in my time when I'm meant to be enjoying myself? Not really! Its for that reason alone I feel I have to give this a 'no' on the recommend at the moment. If there was a "I like the game but can't recommend becuase of a bloody dragon" button, I'd select that instead!

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								EDITED EDITED:Is it the DayZ of Skyrim? Or is it the open world Dark Souls where you craft your own gear? Perhaps you are looking for a game like The Forest with functioning multiplayer for up to 7 friends? Whatever it is, its cold. Its cold all the time.Very very good so far at this time of early access - everything works. You can play alone but its a fun co-op adventure and super easy to get started. You can make a server right from the start menu, make it PVP or PVE, and make it public or private. The first map is an open world island and if you wander too far too soon, you will be crushed. The beta map by comparison is more attractive but more structured. I dont feel the same fear of leaving the beach, but its going to make a great single player or coop adventure. Theres now one spawn so I dont know how that will work for multiplayer pvp, maybe they will keep both maps? Overall the new map design is smart because it will draw more players than just the hardcore survival crowd.The super active devs are constantly changing and adding things so who who knows where it goes?It is an adventure itself watching the game evolve. In a good way!Regardless it is still a crafting-survival-inventory management adventure that I enjoy.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands (Osiris Review)These guidelines being covered- Playing- Contact With Developers- Gameplay Opinion- If you should buy it or not?1.         This game when I was playing kind of made me feel like this, Oh god another early access game that's good probably the developers don't even care like the last ones. I was blown away on one Thursday, I decided, Hey why don't I stop being a scrooge? Well. I did and the stream surprised me, Instead of devs just talking about their game, They were talking to people in the stream, They acted like your average gamer and it really surprised me because they had heart for their game instead of being like boring and wanting money, They wanted the experience of meeting different people. They were very open about questions and didn't really hide much from the players. They even opened up a server which everyone wanted to join but sadly it got full and some people got sad, So I decided to be nice in said stream and give the studio games to hand out to people. But the game's community and playing is very very fun, Quite excellent in fact. Let's get into it shall we?2.       The contact with the developers is very very open, They are just gamers with a developing studio practically. They created a great game in the past but they just show what game industry should be. Don't be afraid to help them out by going on their community or their streams and ask questions. They are very kind!3.        My opinion on gameplay is the fact it's changing every aspect of a normal RPG, This game brought a new context to fantasy, Realistic Fantasy. This showed how one would survive in a harsh fantasy world and try to be a great warrior at the same time. Just trying to make a living on the isle. It created it's own new genre, It's a survival fantasy game. It's savage lands. It's own thing. The best way to describe it fully is get the game, It is worth the price! It is worth the fun! It is hard but playing with friends who have just makes it better. Now the cons in my opinion I hate. This game is still be worked on but heres the thing I have an issue with.. It's some of the multiplayer bugs and the voice chat. Trust me the voice chat literally sounds like Darth Vader had the voice of Sean Connery. It's bad but it will be fixed hopefully. But the game overall gets my seal of approval. The Osiris Badass Award.4. Should you buy it or not?        Well if you like these kind of games YES! Unlike most early access games it is actually a very fair price, They gotta make money for it's development but they show they do care. They will make your dollar worth more every Thursday, They usually release updates every Thursday too! They tell you about upcoming ones as well! But it's worth buying if you have the money. It is a bunch of fun and scary. It has regained trust for me for early access games. This game personally helped me through some dark times by making me feel better. It's given me fun memories for me and my friends. It was a game I've been waiting for personally and it's here. This game is a worth to try and you will not regret once you see what your up againest. I won't spoil everything. You gotta play for yourself to truly know savage lands. That's my reviewBy Osiris Bragindine (Niko)

								Okay so I'm not very good at reviews but heres my thought on the game, it has potential, at the moment it doesnt have that much for a £10 game, so I would advise getting it while it is on sale.Pros:Fun multiplayerGot to make sure your warm and fed or you will dieA range of difficult monstersCrafting and nice looking buildingsCons:Multiplayer can be laggySome monsters are easy to predict and are slowNot many bosses and some locked locations at the momentHouses are expensive and some seem useless unless you have a big communityWhats it about/what could they add?Well from my experience you start on an island which is full of wrecked places, there's plenty of resources as long as you know where to look, food can be caught from traps or from hunting, you also need to make sure you don't freeze which is a good idea as it is a frozen wasteland, theres also notes you can collect so my guess is there might be a quest system later and it would be interesting if you could restore some of the places and NPC's join and you have a town full of NPc's and your friends/randomers.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played most of my in-game hours in mid-2015, it seemed bare bones and awkward then, but had (has) potential. It's still EA - so it will probably improve. Come late 2016...still clunky interface, twitchy mouse etc....but easy fixes, however easy fixes that still haven't been fixed. The world itself though feels somehow contrived and fake, graphics are ok but not mind blowing. Wildlife list is excruciatingly slowly expanding but still very limited. Having returned to the game after 12+ months away I was standing on beach near spawn point, took literally 10 seconds to look at the interface book thing to see what I can do and was killed by a boar before I could craft anything or see what was even possible to do. Respawn, same spot, open menu to see if I can find what is needed to craft a weapon - killed by a wolf or something under 20 seconds from spawn time. Respawn, decide trying to understand what the hell I can do or make is a fatal error at this point so I walk along beach following a couple of markers to a burned out ruined building 200 metres away when the game's resident dragon comes along before I even made a sweep around the remains of one building.......closed game and went back to ARK which has been on EA for half the time, is much more graphically appealing (not sure if ARK has more content as I still don't know what was in my mysterious SL book) and gives the noob on the beach at least a couple of minutes to discover his/her character and a few capabilities.Long and the short of it.....don't p**s off your customers as soon as they walk in the door.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have written relatively few reviews for games but felt that a review for this game was warranted.PROS:-Extremely atmospheric. The transition between day and night along with the weather effects develops a sense of extreme phobia (Have I stocked enough wood and flint to maintain my fires throughout the night... do I have enough bandages?). Furthemore the music compliments the gameplay extremely well.-Crafting system is fleshed out and makes sense.-Mining system is unique and not voxel based (like mine craft). -Plays extremely smoothly on my computer on full settings, very beautiful gameCONS: - Jumping is practically useless - I noticed some graphical glitches. For example I bult a stone house and if i walk up to the wall of the house I will clip through and see outside.- Killing deer is a ♥♥♥♥♥ without a bow, you end up having to chase the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s all across the map and hit them once....extremely annoying.- Building shelters is extremely fun ,but the lack of options to build your base are few....- Enemy AI. Although I have not progressed extremely far into the game, I noticed that if you are one on one against a skeleton or a pack of dogs) it is easy to dispatch them by circling around them and hitting.SUGGESTIONS:- A rudimentary map system... that reveals itself as you explore. This can be established via a logbook that your character draws in or some form...otherwise it is extremely easy to get lost and lose where your base is at. If this is not the way to do it, at least allow for the placement of markers on the ground so you can find your way back.- No walls or fortifications for your base . . . If my team and I decide to permanently make a location our base of operations, it just makes sense to have wooden or stone walls developed (with guard towers if possible) so that we have a safe place to defend.... This would make the game that much more immersive-Traps! If no foritifactions let us at least develop traps to lure enemies into (such as the infamous pungie pits)... this would bring a level of strategy to the game that is otherwise missing.... -You mentioned on the most recent stream the plan to incorporate a system of blocking with a shield... it would be nice to also use your shield to bash and stun an enemy....- It would be nice to have caverns and caves in the game (if not already incorporated). A relatively small recessed cave could be used as a great base. Also exploring dank, dark caves would just add to the immersion of the game.- There is a neat system for hunger and cold in the game, but no system for water.  As anyone who is halfway intelligent knows, a person can last a while without food (even if they are starving) but without water, you are as good as dead... so incorporating a thirst system would be awesome!- The current building system is neat, but how about expanding it? For example, the current Stone House building, once finished, has a torch on the inside that you can light (when adding the materials to it)... The system is already there so how about we expand on the house we already built. Make it larger, add a second floor, add a well for drawing water (see aformentioned request for a water system).

content:
Posted: February 4
Early Access Review
								I purchased Savage Lands more than a year ago and enjoyed playing the content it had back then, even if it was very early-access-ish without too much content. But it had potential, being a quite difficult game set in a harsh world and I liked it.Since then I didn't play any of it. Starting it up again today (on a different account) really surprised me, in a positive way. The amount of content the developers added over all this time is quite impressive and the game was improved a lot, especially gameplay-wise. The multiplayer is a lot of fun and it's extremely satisfying to adventure, fight, build and survive together.I still think Savage Lands has a lot of potential, which it hasn't reached yet, and it's a long way until it gets close. The big plus is it standing out from the other survival games, as long as it sticks to it's mood and doesn't try to become easier/more mainsteam. Nevertheless, the devs definitely have to work a lot to improve it's current state and status in the gaming community. In my opinion, they are headed in the right direction.

content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								don't review games much,,, because reviewing games is like interpreting someones   delusiions.... ya gets what ya pays for,,, I like this game.. First crafting survival game I have played... bout 7 hours of play time..pros: New game- And very dirfrent, initially, there is a little hand holding that gives you a vey simple and safe opportunity to craft:  a fire place and a lean two;; you find an axe, chop down a couple of trees, collect some stone,, and then kill two  deer,, then you are pretty much on your own... I have not seen a map,      Environment: looks good, appears to be very Nordic,,, I have not played skyrim,, but looks similar, a little.. Picture an icelandic coast with snow squalls, wind and distant mountains,,,, appears to be wide open, not at all linear,, Haven't progressed much because i keep on dying,,, skelteons, not a problem it the wolves and other carnivores...speaking of dying, as of yet, the game does not support   a save mechanism.. you die, you respawn back on the coast: Naked, the respawn provides a bright red skull you are able to follow back to your corpes.... Problem, by the time you make it back to your body most times you wiill freeze to  death or die in a wolf attack... I have died bout 5 times ..Graphics: look good,,, I get some frame stutter,,,have been fooling around with the settings,,, I have an 8 core processor  running at 3.4, 16 gigs of 2400 ram, Asus 370 Strix 4 gigs.. so, don't think its my hardware   Exploration: this game is not a back yard barberque sim... It is SURVIVAL.  You sit you die, you don't chop wood, you die, you don't hunt and gather, you die...you cook all your meat, you hunt your meat,, Cave man meets the stoneage sim.    Inventory is a bit of a learning cure,,, crafting seems easy, eveything you have you either find or make,, Recommend: BUY IT,,, and get yer caveman on, remember it's only a game,,, beats siting in LA traffic or shoveling snow or counting the days to next ChristmasBetter than donkey kong and pitfall,,,

Early Access Review
								This game is tough. It throws you into a cold world, and immediately you have to find a place to keep warm.Starting out blind, this game can be really brutal. I started fresh in the early days of Savage Lands, and it's only grown and become more in depth. There's no doubt starting out is now tougher in the updated game.Though my experience with the game, it's pretty solid. I don't really encounter too many bugs, and I've personally never crashed. Even when I do find a bug, it has never once felt game breaking.Savage Lands is packed with content in it's current state: teired gear, interesting loot, quite a few enemy types, mid and end-game bosses. You could easily get quite a few hours trying to discover the lore, and find those rarer items needed for that end-game gear to defeat the dragon.The developers are active with this game and involve the community. They host development livestreams where you can ask question and preview new features. I personally really enjoy the streams.The game has come such a long way since I first began playing, and I cannot wait to see what it becomes.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								***EDITAfter discussion with Kevin from Signal who reassures me that food is being rebalanced soon and managing to successfully build a wooden shack in a reasonable amount of time (now with full access to its interior) I'm feeling a lot more positive about the future of the game. Things are definitely being worked on and that is one of the most reassuring things in an EA game.It is still needing more development, but if you are willing to deal with rapidly-changing gameplay and the usual woes and uncertainties of Early Access and if you like a challenging survival game, I do recommend Savage Lands. Those lands really are quite savage, but they are beautiful too.END OF EDIT***I find Savage Lands to be be strangely frustrating. I play single player and the difficulty is punishing. I'm glad that there is finally a health bar for enemies, but overall I think that I enjoyed the game more a year ago than I do now.The new map is attractive and the graphics are good, but starting out is now even harder. I played for a few hours today and my little dude, Amy*, needs to eat about 5 pigs a day, just to not starve to death. Amy apparently has an amazing metabolism, perhaps it's the cold climate. Chopping down a tree with low level tools now takes 4 times as long as before and pretty much destroys the axe after 1 tree. I'm not sure if it's been fixed yet, but the last time I tried building a house (which took ages what with the slow chopping and the rapidly disintegrating axes) I couldn't actually get inside it, because the doorway was too small. So now I am spending an excruciatingly long time building a stone house. Apparently, they are easier to enter. I sure hope so.I frequently get a bug that makes it so that the crafting recipe for an item only appears if I don't have the materials in my inventory, making crafting things a right pain in the posterior. Relogging does fix it temporarily, but it's really frustrating.Getting cold reduces the health bar, but warming back up doesn't allow the lost health to regenerate. So I try to only eat when near a fire so that I can restore the lost health and frankly, it's just another annoyance. As soon as you walk away from your fire you are becoming injured by cold.There are plenty of updates and the game is still in active development, unfortunately the development feels somewhat chaotic and it's very difficult to find up-to-date info on anything.I would love to explore further and see more of the world and possibly it would be a whole lot more fun with a group of friends, but the way that I am feeling right now is that I cannot recommend it in its current state. Hopefully, one day things will feel more balanced and less buggy, but I suspect that the developers are focused more on creating the game that they want to play, rather than the game that I want to play, which is of course their prerogative, but I cannot recommend a game that I'm not really enjoying playing.*My little dude is called Amy, in honour of the fact that I cannot play as a female character.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands is a lovely open-world sandbox survival game with a sizeable map, good crafting system, decent amount of weapons and armor, and several creatures to fight and kill.  As other reviewers have mentioned, this is an early access game so garden variety bugs and glitches do occur  (none of them gamebreaking).PROS:-Items don't despawn, so you can drop an item and it will stay there (seemingly) forever-Night/Day Cycle: allows for longer days than nights, so you can get more mining and hunting done in the daylight hours when it's safer-Map: quite large, albeit somewhat difficult to navigate at first (the compass helps a lot)-Crafting: lots of crafting options for several seperate sets of armor, several weapons, and a few buildings-Weather: snowstorms really add to the survival aspect of the game because you can die of exposure very quickly if not well equipped, especially when compounded with being in the world at night CONS:-Tbh, there really aren't many other than the run of the mill EA bugs What I'd Like to See:-In game map (again, the compass helps, but the community-made map has helped me out quite a bit)-More enemies, creatures, weapons, armor, buildings, crafting options, etc.  Beacause the game is EA, I surmise we will be seeing the majority of these gaming aspects in the (hopefully) near future.I'm very much enjoying this game and I can't wait to see where the game goes from here!!!Also to the Devs: Thank you so much for making such a fun game for both pc and mac, for they are few and far between on mac.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands is a lovely open-world sandbox survival game with a sizeable map, good crafting system, decent amount of weapons and armor, and several creatures to fight and kill.  As other reviewers have mentioned, this is an early access game so garden variety bugs and glitches do occur  (none of them gamebreaking).PROS:-Items don't despawn, so you can drop an item and it will stay there (seemingly) forever-Night/Day Cycle: allows for longer days than nights, so you can get more mining and hunting done in the daylight hours when it's safer-Map: quite large, albeit somewhat difficult to navigate at first (the compass helps a lot)-Crafting: lots of crafting options for several seperate sets of armor, several weapons, and a few buildings-Weather: snowstorms really add to the survival aspect of the game because you can die of exposure very quickly if not well equipped, especially when compounded with being in the world at night CONS:-Tbh, there really aren't many other than the run of the mill EA bugs What I'd Like to See:-In game map (again, the compass helps, but the community-made map has helped me out quite a bit)-More enemies, creatures, weapons, armor, buildings, crafting options, etc.  Beacause the game is EA, I surmise we will be seeing the majority of these gaming aspects in the (hopefully) near future.I'm very much enjoying this game and I can't wait to see where the game goes from here!!!Also to the Devs: Thank you so much for making such a fun game for both pc and mac, for they are few and far between on mac.

								(beta review) This was my favorite game for some time... got my money's worth in classic branch of the Beta. Good story, mechanics, etc.  With the complete re-build in a new engine half way through the game beta, maybe this should have been 2 separate games?  If devs ever get the new build more playable  (I'm Linux with i7 3770s, 16Gig ram, Nvidia GTX-1050Ti) I'll honestly feel like I got 2 games for the price of 1.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								An amazing break from the ordinary as far as survival sandbox games go. Before going to far into yes, the game is Early Access, and yes, there are some bugs, (deer twitching around in areas with a high tree density, two packs of wolves travelling on top of each other for a total of 8 etc) but none of them are game breaking IMO.    Too many survival sandbox games have popped up promising a lot and offering so little. If you are like me at all and want a sandbox game in which you dont have to worry about mobs of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥killing you at spawn (DayZ, Nether, Ark, Rust, and any other game in which you spawn on a beach) or those same mobs of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥breaking into your house when youre gone due to real life responsibilities and robbing you of 10s of hours then this is a game for you. The community is great as far as i can tell, in the time that i have played i have had no issues with griefers or trolls. The game in itself is amazing, a huge map to explore, diverse amount and types of enemies to kill and be killed by. Building system similiar to the forest, which works just fine IMO  Crafting system is pretty fantastic as well, well a good amount of armour and weapons to craft, lots of storage options.And the game is updated on a fairly regular basis.    Also easy to connect to and play with friendsI really hope the game continues at its current pace, as this game has, on its own, restored my faith in the Steam EA program                                                                                      10/10 Would get lost, freeze, bleed, and burn to death again

content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great game! One of the very few survival games today that isn't filled with game-breaking bugs, and doesn't have the same  gameplay as the previous games. The game requires you to be patient while you're hunting, crafting and doing your best to survive in the wilderness against many (scary) creatures. Definitely recommended for survival fans who are (like myself) tired of seeing games with potential get ruined because of lazy developers. The devs in this game are active every day, and provide you specific details on when the next update will be available, bringing even more and more content to the table to prevent you from boredom. They are extremely kind and do their best to get this game out of early access and make it a damn good survival game. Great job on this one :)!

Early Access Review
								Loaded in with 2 friends to play. Not played solo, however it's a GREAT game while playing with friends. Started off building our little village. Was great working together, one on deforesting the area, one mining and one hunting. Got ourselves built up fairly well, running around to keep each other alive as we had to push further to mine. Watched a few dev streams and happy to see there's still a lot of ideas and work being put in to the game. Loving the game now and excited to see what happens in the future. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								To clarify this for people looking to buy the game, read below.1. The game has a solid amount of content for its current status. Even when you've crafted the best armour in the game, there are still bosses and monsters for you to hunt to get even stronger weapons. There are a few bosses to fight, including a dragon which is best fought with a ton of preparation, team work and time. He's not easy to kill, with a massive HP pool and enough damage to drop you and your party in seconds without proper preparation. The world is fairly large, and somewhat unsafe to travel through alone. This game is best played and enjoyed with friends.2. This isn't as free-form as some other sandbox games, where architecture and building is a big part of the gaming experience. This game focuses more on the survival aspect and conquering the environment around you as you slowly build up your character through crafting new armor and weapons. There are structures you can build, some of which are incredibly important, some that are literally useless. Once you play the game for an hour or so, you'll understand why building structures doesn't really take away from the game's experience.3. The combat is good. Could be better, but it gets the job done in a non-frustrating way. Blocking is something that could be added to make it a more skilled experience overall. PvP could be a great aspect of this game if there were some minor tweaks done to the combat. 4. This game is well optimized (graphically speaking) and incredibly atmospheric. You may find yourself stopping to just look around at the harsh snow, fog, sun rays piercing through the vegetation or even the deer you're about to hunt just stroll through the woods peacefully. Best played with headphones. Overall, the game is satisfying, and definitely worth the price. It could use a bit more content to fill the large landscape you have to explore though. Caves or dungeons could be a good idea. Just more areas to explore within the given land.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Going to keep this pretty short as its late and I should have stopped playing hours ago :PProsPlayed with a friend and had a great time.  Finally a survival game that actually has some strife to survive!  Definitely an old school feel to the game overall.  No map function is great and really draws you in, I cannot stand games today that have the guiding light from the sky to show you where to go...  I followed the game and joined a few TTV streams before purchasing.  Devs are very devoted and interact with their community constantly which is a rare thing to see.  This is an EA done right.  Had such a great time in its current state and can see it only getting better.ConsThe shore definitely needs some optimizations where the water is breaking on the beach.  My frames were dropping hard whenever I was near the water break.  As soon as the break was out of view the game ran wonderfully with zero fps issues.  Dedicated server would really make this game much better as well.  However, the devs have already stated in a recent TTV stream this is a feature coming soon (few weeks).  Overall, happy to support the game with the 4 pack I purchased and would die to freezing ocean again :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								Could be a really great game with so much potential, but it's really underdeveloped yet. I gave a thumbs up because I had 9 hours of fun until my friend I discovered everything that are still not implemented in the game. We even climbed up half way on the dragon tower.I hope the developers won't give up on this game, because they can make a great survival fantasy game. Pros:- Great environment and overall feel (until I noticed that the dragon won't do anything, it was really scary to always look up to the sky and check if it's near)- Nice building system and textures for the houses (they are really cozy when finished)- Heck of a lot recipes (it's not for everybody, but I love a game when there's always something new in the recipes section)- Nice gear textures (maybe it's a bit too early to write this, because I only managed to create leather and fur cuirasses, but I loved how they looked)- Not bad combat system, but still needs a lot of work- Really creative items can be created (I love the respawn item and that if you kill somebody you can just put his/her head on a spike right infront of your house)Cons:- I think some of the mobs are way too powerful.- Also they are glitchy (sometimes they just disappear)- The spawn system is a joke currently. One island is full of animals and mobs and the other is just plain empty.- There are a lot of materials that are not implemented yet (I never managed to find iron, gold, lion flower etc., but maybe I wasn't really lucky with them)- The mining is just tedious     - It doesn't matter if you have a betterm hammer you won't be able to mine more or faster- Terrible inventory system- Not easy to play with your friend (can't create groups)Overall:Only buy this game if you are brave enough to bet on the developers for future updates. Currently I don't think it's worth 14,99 euros but definitely worth to buy it via Humble Bundle (as I did ;)). I will update this review maybe a year later. I hope the devs will work on this game! :)

Early Access Review
								10/10 survival game if you're no stranger to the genre. I have no frame issues besides when using portals and the difficulty ramp is excellent. content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok someone help me understand why this is getting good reviews...-Great Graphics-sparse resources for crafting and especially food you will eventually no matter what u do starve to death-craft a house and some armor and youve basically beat the game and there is no longer any point to go on livingThis is looking like another pointless survival/crafting game with no depth and no goals.Why go on surviving in an empty world 30minutes and youll be bored.Update:Have been playing the beta version so I could test the update-still having poor frame rate but by no means uplayable-With relightable campfire farming food while tedious is fairly easy to stock up on-Fighting is basically hit trading, look forward to seeing more combat mechanics like parry and block-Much easier to survive with increased dura and deer and animal debuffs-crafted armor still degrades fairly fast for what it costs to createUpdate:Wow this game is improving at an absolutely insane rate these guys must be popping crank and washing it down with redbull.  Seriously no idea how they can roll in the Updates so fast.  Every week theres a new one.  Anyways just played some totally worth buying at its current state

content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								After playing for several hours, its a fresh experience to survive under such harsh environment. Its good to see some lore on the island. Its funny to coop with other players to live on the savage lands.Since this game is still in early access period, I think the problems within the game is understadable.It will be good if the following points can be fulfilled.Technical:1) Allow opengl 2.1 and 4.5 to be performed on windows so that players can have more choices to run the game2) Bug solving: In coop mode, joiners may see the flashing creatures and those creatures cannot be hitted.Game play:1) Quest mode: There is large potential for the game to be further developed so that the game can have more realistic gaming experiences. The current problem of the game is the lack of human issue such as how people act in order to survive. It will be good to start from a group of people and NPCs arriving the land accidently and have to find out the reasons they come to the land and the reasons of disappearance of the natives. And set continuation of that group of people and the land survivors on the island as the final target. I am not talking about another skyrim, but instead a real survival game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great game, especially for early accessWhile this game has decent content as is, I can see some people being bored with what there is now, however, keeping in mind that this is early access i see a lot of potential in it. Another thing i would like to mention is that the setting feels like a real place, i often find that in games there are often places that seem completely impossible and they're usually all over the place, this game makes the world feel very possible, roaming enemies may also attribute to this feeling of realism.Graphically it's good considering it's in-progress state but nothing to write home about.Audio wise i actually quite like it, i usually listen to podcasts while i game so i shut off the music but the ambient audio is really nice, it's fairly good quality, and simple enough to be both pleasent and immersive.Gameplay (control) is good, controls well and the options available make things nice, it may be a personal thing but being able to set any command to any key is incredibly nice and almost a shock to see in a game of this level of development, i feel a lot of people won't even notice this but i feel it deserves a mention.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have only played this game for a few hours and all i have to say is, wow. This game is absolutley awesome!! I love playing it and exploring and surviving! All those people who say this game is way to hard are a bunch of pansies. If anything this games difficulty could be amped up!! Its especially easy if you have someone to play with. And even playing with your friends is easy because its based on a host game and not a massive server so itll only be you and your friend! The crafting menu is super easy to get used to, surviving makes sense (eating, healing, getting warm, etc.). Watch a youtube video or 2 of someone playing this game just to get the essentials down of how to start out and you will be fine. I love skyrim and like minecraft and the two of them meeting has been awesome! Overall this game is 10/10 and i recommend if you have any interest in this game, definitely get it! I am a "save all the money i can" kind of guy and was weary of buying another game but this one did not dissappoint!!!Thanks devs!! Cant wait for more updates to come!!

Early Access Review
								Dropped off on an island you have nothing. Cold, Hunger and Health play a part as they would realisticly so gamers can really have an experience where they have to keep themselves alive. As one gets deeper in the island there are more enemies especially at night so its quite easy to find yourselves with no food, no fire and no shelter, or get lost and can't find your base! you can use the ruins of bases on the island or make your own buildings yourself. I quite liked that you can place logs into a building and it will gradually form shape. For an early release it is great its similar viewing to Skyrim, visually stunning.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I do reccomend this game for the POTENTIAL not for it's current condition. There are a few feedbacks that I hope the developers will take time to read :) I think that a larger selection of hostile entities, more terrain variety (I think new maps will most likely be added in the future), A server hosting system at some point like minecraft where you have a permanent server that is up (whitelisted perhaps) and people can join, more options for adventuring and exploring like caves and the dragon's tower maybe with loot to be found in places like the village would add very very much to the gameplay experience. Obviously there will be more items added and maybe things like neutral NPCs. AND HERE MY MOST IMPORTANT RECCOMENDATION. The ability to terraform an area and BUILD WALLS LIKE A VILLAGE FOR SERVERS. Without terraforming currently the only way to bulid a halfway decent house is to build it in the village that alrealy has flat ground where you won't be able to peek under the walls and where you don't feel like a savage because your floor is the snowy grass.

A fantastic, magnificent, fresh, and most of all-- fun new experience in the Survival genre***Signal Studios, if you're reading this, please make the OST out for sale. The Kur dragon encounter theme is especially amazing.8.5/10, not yet complete, but it will get a solid 10 when they complete it, I'm sure of it!Have you ever played a game that feels so refreshing and new to you? This is that feeling. Even if you haven't, this will be that first feeling.EDIT:The developers have added more content, and now it feels even more refreshing and a bit more fair.SECOND EDIT: Developers are getting really smart and listening to the fanbase.This is like a mixture of Minecraft and Skyrim. The beauty of skyrim and the exploration of both games. The crafting system is unique like that of Minecraft.Although there are so many positives to this game, and you should absolutely get it, I write this review extremely infuriated. Although there are so many pros, there are cons.Pros +:http://steamcommunity.com/id/ksobenes/screenshot/421440386972373147 http://steamcommunity.com/id/ksobenes/screenshot/421440386972372652 OH  MY GOD THE MONOLITH!!!+Well made island that is super massive, you will definately get lost without a compass.+The game keeps you entertained throughout with its breathtaking visuals and stunning gameplay. It is truly a survival game to test your endurance, skill, and most of all-- patience.+The combat can be pretty smooth if your mouse and reflexes are good.+The Developers actually fix the issues instead of shoving their thumbs firmly up their♥♥♥♥♥♥ and saying "Nah, screw you we'll do what we want when we want!!!". I feel a bunch of passion in this game, and they fix the issues. I removed a few cons just to show how much they listen to the player base.+Kur the Dragon fight added. Practically the new "Forest Giant" since the Forest Giant finally got nerfed to be soloable.+New weapons released that look very inspiring. I can tell there is going to be some casting of various things in the future if we have a sword that has a magical glow.+So many that I gave up listing them. Just buy it and see for yourself!Cons:-A.I. seems broken at times. As I write this I'm stuck naked on top of a rock while a Dire Bear and Skeleton run around it. They are also really persistant and annoying, to the point where you need to kill them for them to stop chasing them. They are a bit over powered from when you begin, and way too many wolves appear at once, making it extremely hard to stay alive. Every NPC except the skeletons do way too much damage and have way too much health when you first accidentally encounter them, at least have a loud noise of a bear/plague wolf that you can hear as soon as you get close to the area. And you have to run into them regularly in order to get to the resources you need. They end up killing you and you can't move your respawn point unless you build another one, which is impossible if you can't kill skeletons and chop wood, which is impossible because you don't have any tools upon respawning and lose everything. You have to start an entirely new character if you die while you're lost or die a few times to lead the npc's away so you can retrieve your stuff then kill every last one of them. The A.I. keeps you staying on a rock for five minutes while you freeze to death and never stop chasing you unless you are on a rock for five freaking minutes, which in turn drains your heat meter, which in turn, lowers your health.-There needs to be a map for the entire island that draws itself out as you explore so you can get back to where you were/where you want to explore so you don't get so lost.New strategy to counteract this is a Compass, a death marker, and chopping down millions of trees to make weapon racks as a "bread crumb" trail. -Needs less limits on what you can and cannot craft without a blacksmith. You can practically only craft one in an area or else you will most likely die trying to build another one and cannot find it. There needs to be some kind of portable smithy or something. They added a rare "smithy" attached to a burned down home in old villages.-Plauge wolves spawn in the beginning parts of the island where you spawn if you go a little far at night and have eyes behind their tiny testicular organs so they can see behind them a mile away. Nearly impossible to kill with a starter hammer, and they spawn as you begin.-No bear should take 15-25 arrows to kill, even if it's a dire bear, and treat your armor like it's just wet paper.They fixed up the bears, good trade off of Power and Defense with them. Good melee blade will be able to fix them up.-No wolf pack made up of 10 wolves should do 5 damage to you when you have full armor on you and a Wolfsbane. (That's the reason I rage quit for a bit at one time.)-No wolf, bear, skeleton or any creature that ever existed would follow you to hell itself and back just to bite you. Especially when they can kill you so easily with full armor on.-Your armor breaks way too easily, especially the top tier armor, Ebon Steel.Overall, it's a great game, but it needs fixes in the NPC's and enemies. Especially how persistant they are. I haven't been this mad at a game since Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate and Sm4sh, even though how wonderful this game is. However, despite its difficulties, you cannot help but return to it. It's too much of a treasure to skip out on, especially when it's on sale. Buy it for yourself and your friends too!

content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great game, especially for early accessWhile this game has decent content as is, I can see some people being bored with what there is now, however, keeping in mind that this is early access i see a lot of potential in it. Another thing i would like to mention is that the setting feels like a real place, i often find that in games there are often places that seem completely impossible and they're usually all over the place, this game makes the world feel very possible, roaming enemies may also attribute to this feeling of realism.Graphically it's good considering it's in-progress state but nothing to write home about.Audio wise i actually quite like it, i usually listen to podcasts while i game so i shut off the music but the ambient audio is really nice, it's fairly good quality, and simple enough to be both pleasent and immersive.Gameplay (control) is good, controls well and the options available make things nice, it may be a personal thing but being able to set any command to any key is incredibly nice and almost a shock to see in a game of this level of development, i feel a lot of people won't even notice this but i feel it deserves a mention.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Loaded in with 2 friends to play. Not played solo, however it's a GREAT game while playing with friends. Started off building our little village. Was great working together, one on deforesting the area, one mining and one hunting. Got ourselves built up fairly well, running around to keep each other alive as we had to push further to mine. Once we reached a point where our equipment was fairly strong we began exploring. Spent a day preparing, repearing our equpiment, hunting for food and farming the essentials to keep ourselves alive. Started travelling through the day and setting up camp during the nights. Was real fun having to plan for each day, fighting to keep each other alive and travelling the island. Watched a few dev streams and happy to see there's still a lot of ideas and work being put in to the game. Loving the game now and excited to see what happens in the future. Edit: Watching dev stream now. My first decision on this game was to run out in to the forest naked... the dragon got me. Loved it! :D

content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								I don't normally review my steam games but I'm sick of this one getting♥♥♥♥♥♥all over so I wanted to add my $.02. As of 8/09/16 this game's major problem seems to have been addressed, that was the one shotting dragon overlord who eats whiners and complainers. He has been balanced out. As long as you don't get to close to his tower, (there's really no reason to if you're unprepared), he probably won't eat you. The dragon does seem to leave the tower now and again but he usually stays put now around noobs now and, according to the dev notes, would rather focus on more formitable players. This is a fun survival, crafting game set in a fridgid fantasy world. It is a little challenging to solo but it's not impossible and it seems to be easier (and funner!) with a friend. It also gets regular updates. I reccomend this game, especially if it's on sale or in a bundle but I don't think the regular asking price of $15 is too steep considering the frequent updates and the general enjoyableness of the game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								To clarify this for people looking to buy the game, read below.1. The game has a solid amount of content for its current status. Even when you've crafted the best armour in the game, there are still bosses and monsters for you to hunt to get even stronger weapons. There are a few bosses to fight, including a dragon which is best fought with a ton of preparation, team work and time. He's not easy to kill, with a massive HP pool and enough damage to drop you and your party in seconds without proper preparation. The world is fairly large, and somewhat unsafe to travel through alone. This game is best played and enjoyed with friends.2. This isn't as free-form as some other sandbox games, where architecture and building is a big part of the gaming experience. This game focuses more on the survival aspect and conquering the environment around you as you slowly build up your character through crafting new armor and weapons. There are structures you can build, some of which are incredibly important, some that are literally useless. Once you play the game for an hour or so, you'll understand why building structures doesn't really take away from the game's experience.3. The combat is good. Could be better, but it gets the job done in a non-frustrating way. Blocking is something that could be added to make it a more skilled experience overall. PvP could be a great aspect of this game if there were some minor tweaks done to the combat. 4. This game is well optimized (graphically speaking) and incredibly atmospheric. You may find yourself stopping to just look around at the harsh snow, fog, sun rays piercing through the vegetation or even the deer you're about to hunt just stroll through the woods peacefully. Best played with headphones. Overall, the game is satisfying, and definitely worth the price. It could use a bit more content to fill the large landscape you have to explore though. Caves or dungeons could be a good idea. Just more areas to explore within the given land.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Although the "early access" label is a much-needed warning on this game, it still manages to be an intriguing and fairly fun time. The developers certainly seem to be listening to complaints: many of the negative reviews here revolve around problems that no longer exist. To be sure, it's still very clunky, and many aspects are unintuitive while others seem spoonfed to excess, but I'm going to keep playing and exploring. This is probably one of those games that I'll play happily for 3-10 hours, uninstall, then reinstall a few months later when the itch returns, and that seems like a fine return for 20ish bucks. If you can buy it for less (I got it on the Humble Bundle), then I strongly recommend doing so.Pros:- Strong solo experience- Clear crafting progression- Visible goals that are not forced- Manageable danger- Apparent developer attentivenessCons:- Shallow character creation (no female option, one body type)- Bland cold open- Inconsistencies in usefulness:accessibility and difficulty:visibility- Dull writing- Lag, jitters, etc.Some of the above issues will, I'm sure, be fixed as the game nears completion, and are more of a reflection of where the developers' attention seems to be. If you're here for Skyrim Meets Minecraft, then this is a game worth following, but if you're here for Dragon's Dogma Meets Stardew Valley then it's probably best to move on.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								As of 8/14/2016 build 306 (Early Access) I'm writing this review:Savage Lands is a 'hardcore' survival game set in a medieval fantasy era with dragons and skeletons walking around. Seems simple enough but the atmosphere is definitely perfect for the setting, with every sound keeping you on edge whether an enemy is attacking or your next meal is running.But no amount of atmostphere can sadly remove the tediousness of  collecting  finding a single vein of ore or the seemingly empty world where you can run through an entire forest without finding a single entity day or night. And of course being Early Access theres bugs, items disappearing, floating rocks, god mode cheating *** mobs and the ability to animals to seemingly morph into a rock formation as you hunt them.Currently the devs are on a good track and are trying to fix these bugs as well as add more content to the islands of the game. Each update addresses issues and the devs are currently playing around with the spawn rates of items and mobs so its definitly finicky currently.PROS: crafting system actually feels like you're crafting atmospheric when not buggy a large amount of content already Devs are updating fairly frequently with actual patches and additionsCONS: finding ore veins and general collecting can be extremely tedious especially early on large patches of land with literally nothing  extremely buggy at times ie AI of mobs running through rocks or inventory disappears when dropped onto ground spawn rates of mobs can be wonky with sometimes upwards of 30-40 spawning (rarely) to only 1-2 appearingOverall its one of those cases of wanting to recommend and not recommend in its current state but with im hoping future patches many issues should be addressed and the game just that more enjoyable

content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								While the game is clearly not finished and I wasn't expecting to like it when I started playing, I do recommend it for those who enjoy multiplayer crafting/survival. This review is current as of v0.8.3 build 306 (11th August 2016). Update: I've been out wandering all over now, even almost climbed a dragon tower before I found out you can't. At this point in time I feel there need to be more to do and would really like some buildable stairs and platforms.I have not encountered death from the dragon once (even walking right up to it's tower) as some others seem to (I think it got patched) and most of the wildlife is easy enough to kill, at least on the starting island. I've started several new games and every time the dragon has stayed away. Once you venture across the long bridge the enemies (skeletons) seem to get better equipped and can kill you quite quickly, and there are other things lurking in the woods.One thing the game doesn't have which I would like to see is skills you can buy with experience from things you accomplish, such as being able to sprint longer, freeze/starve more slowly, harvest more ore from mining sites before they are depleted and increase weapon damage or armour protection. This isn't a huge thing missing from the game but I feel the experience would benefit from having at least some small ways to improve your character.The biggest issues I've had so far are;- the interface isn't explained (it's not incredibly complex but a short tutorial to tell you what's what and how it works would be helpful). For those wondering, you can split a stack of items by holding shift and clicking with LMB, and items can be quickly picked up in the inventory by double-clicking with LMB.- on some games the wildlife decides to just randomly stop spawning in certain areas for a while (in my first game my friend and I began starving after day 2 because there was nothing around to kill).- most physical structures have to be built from your journal in the house tab, which is confusing and nothing tells you to look for them in there. Campfires, walls, buildings, traps and various crafting stations are all in your jounal and not the crafting menu. Once you select something to build you put down a blueprint where you want it (mousewheel rotates) and the blueprint then shows the materials needed to build it, which you can add all at once or bit-by-bit. A problem with this is that if you have items on the ground near a blueprint you can accidentally add materials while trying to pick up your stuff.- a few of the items you build in the crafting stations are world-placeable (like chests) but when you make them there's no placement interface, so you end up placing them down only vaguely where you want and with no control over the direction the objects are facing. Furthermore these objects can be knocked over and off surfaces by enemies but you walk right through them and cannot pick them up or adjust them to keep your base tidy.- The only way to unbuild structures it to tear them down and weapons (even stone swords) deal more structure damage than your basic clubs and hatchets, so as soon as you hit tin you'll end up using weapons for everything since they can harvest resources as well. I find this odd.- There are some issues with server hosting. Server privacy is almost nonexistent unless you set a password. Even when I set the game I was hosting to "friends only" I still had random strangers joining every now and then (not a lot of them, but even one is too many). On top of this there are very few things you can do as the host and none of the options are presented to you when starting to host your game, you have to find them in the options menu while playing.- Both the food you eat and the food you keep don't last long enough. Especially considering you're in a very cold area, meat should last longer than it does before spoiling (and there's nothing in the item details to tell you how long it lasts). On top of that everything you DO eat doesn't keep you going for long. If killing a boar the same size as myself only gives me one piece of meat then by golly that piece of meat should keep me going for at least a few days! Because of these issues you'll spend a lot of time hunting and foraging, unless you got lucky like me and had one wild boar after another wander straight into the abandoned village (seriously I killed more than ten of the things while just standing around working on building stuff).- Some things are intuitive, like the fact that you have to mine metals, but others aren't. When I wanted to get clay I had to google it, facepalming at the fact that I have to smash it out of rocks. Thankfully this only seems to be the case for a few items.- Creatures often go straight through rocks and other barriers that you have to go over/around. This is a real issue when you think you have that deer cornered and ripe for stabbing and he just vanishes into the rock face. This only seems ot happen with part of the rocks and I think they get stuck in there sometimes because they don't always come out the other side.- A minor gripe; I once found a compass and was annoyed that I had to hold it in my hand to tell direction. Normally it wouldn't be a bother but with so little inventory space the item wasn't worth the bother to take with me, so I dumped it. Extra equipment slots for things like this would be useful, and having them add a compass bar to the interface instead of holding up the object too. Furthermore as far as I can tell nobody from the abandoned settlements thought having a map would be a good idea despite apparently having enough paper to just leave lots of notes laying around. Even if there isn't a "you are here" marker on them, having some maps of each area to add to your journal and a compass bar would be really nice.- Another minor gripe; In character creation you can only create males, colours are limited to the realistic natural spectrum and half of the tattoos make the characters look like they are wearing t-shirts. Small things really, but I want to have a pink mohawk! D:<All in all I find it fun so far, just watch out for those skeletons, they're surprisingly quiet when they come up behind you!

content:
Posted: April 10
Early Access Review
								I used to play this game a year and a half, maybe two years ago. It was fun back then. It was incredibly barebones, but it was playable, and there was definitely potential. I got it for two other friends and we had a blast for maybe 15 hours before getting bored, but hey it was incredibly early alpha so we were satisfied and hopeful to come back to it later when it'd be more fleshed out.About a year later, I reinstalled it. Here was my experience.- Wake up- Visuals haven't changed much, performance did- Getting stone was way more grindy and took way too long- "How did they make the ai WORSE?"- Immediately on my way to dying, way too quickly. I couldn't even get my bearings, I'm just already freezing and getting hungry- DRAGON. DEAD. Respawn, dragon comes back and breathes fire again. Repeat for entire experience, nonstop- Wolves everywhere. If it was night time, there were always 8 wolves biting at you if you weren't standing out of their reach and a dragon locking on to you if you stand still on said out-of-reach platform. So either you run until you're out of stamina and get mauled / freeze / starve, or you get murdered by the unrelenting dragon- Literally this is default settings, not some crazy hardmode- Uninstall, scarred- Reinstall 5 months later- Exact same, no changeDon't get this game

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Although the "early access" label is a much-needed warning on this game, it still manages to be an intriguing and fairly fun time. The developers certainly seem to be listening to complaints: many of the negative reviews here revolve around problems that no longer exist. To be sure, it's still very clunky, and many aspects are unintuitive while others seem spoonfed to excess, but I'm going to keep playing and exploring. This is probably one of those games that I'll play happily for 3-10 hours, uninstall, then reinstall a few months later when the itch returns, and that seems like a fine return for 20ish bucks. If you can buy it for less (I got it on the Humble Bundle), then I strongly recommend doing so.Pros:- Strong solo experience- Clear crafting progression- Visible goals that are not forced- Manageable danger- Apparent developer attentivenessCons:- Shallow character creation (no female option, one body type)- Bland cold open- Inconsistencies in usefulness:accessibility and difficulty:visibility- Dull writing- Lag, jitters, etc.Some of the above issues will, I'm sure, be fixed as the game nears completion, and are more of a reflection of where the developers' attention seems to be. If you're here for Skyrim Meets Minecraft, then this is a game worth following, but if you're here for Dragon's Dogma Meets Stardew Valley then it's probably best to move on.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								As of 8/14/2016 build 306 (Early Access) I'm writing this review:Savage Lands is a 'hardcore' survival game set in a medieval fantasy era with dragons and skeletons walking around. Seems simple enough but the atmosphere is definitely perfect for the setting, with every sound keeping you on edge whether an enemy is attacking or your next meal is running.But no amount of atmostphere can sadly remove the tediousness of  collecting  finding a single vein of ore or the seemingly empty world where you can run through an entire forest without finding a single entity day or night. And of course being Early Access theres bugs, items disappearing, floating rocks, god mode cheating *** mobs and the ability to animals to seemingly morph into a rock formation as you hunt them.Currently the devs are on a good track and are trying to fix these bugs as well as add more content to the islands of the game. Each update addresses issues and the devs are currently playing around with the spawn rates of items and mobs so its definitly finicky currently.PROS: crafting system actually feels like you're crafting atmospheric when not buggy a large amount of content already Devs are updating fairly frequently with actual patches and additionsCONS: finding ore veins and general collecting can be extremely tedious especially early on large patches of land with literally nothing  extremely buggy at times ie AI of mobs running through rocks or inventory disappears when dropped onto ground spawn rates of mobs can be wonky with sometimes upwards of 30-40 spawning (rarely) to only 1-2 appearingOverall its one of those cases of wanting to recommend and not recommend in its current state but with im hoping future patches many issues should be addressed and the game just that more enjoyable

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								While the game is clearly not finished and I wasn't expecting to like it when I started playing, I do recommend it for those who enjoy multiplayer crafting/survival. This review is current as of v0.8.3 build 306 (11th August 2016). Update: I've been out wandering all over now, even almost climbed a dragon tower before I found out you can't. At this point in time I feel there need to be more to do and would really like some buildable stairs and platforms.I have not encountered death from the dragon once (even walking right up to it's tower) as some others seem to (I think it got patched) and most of the wildlife is easy enough to kill, at least on the starting island. I've started several new games and every time the dragon has stayed away. Once you venture across the long bridge the enemies (skeletons) seem to get better equipped and can kill you quite quickly, and there are other things lurking in the woods.One thing the game doesn't have which I would like to see is skills you can buy with experience from things you accomplish, such as being able to sprint longer, freeze/starve more slowly, harvest more ore from mining sites before they are depleted and increase weapon damage or armour protection. This isn't a huge thing missing from the game but I feel the experience would benefit from having at least some small ways to improve your character.The biggest issues I've had so far are;- the interface isn't explained (it's not incredibly complex but a short tutorial to tell you what's what and how it works would be helpful). For those wondering, you can split a stack of items by holding shift and clicking with LMB, and items can be quickly picked up in the inventory by double-clicking with LMB.- on some games the wildlife decides to just randomly stop spawning in certain areas for a while (in my first game my friend and I began starving after day 2 because there was nothing around to kill).- most physical structures have to be built from your journal in the house tab, which is confusing and nothing tells you to look for them in there. Campfires, walls, buildings, traps and various crafting stations are all in your jounal and not the crafting menu. Once you select something to build you put down a blueprint where you want it (mousewheel rotates) and the blueprint then shows the materials needed to build it, which you can add all at once or bit-by-bit. A problem with this is that if you have items on the ground near a blueprint you can accidentally add materials while trying to pick up your stuff.- a few of the items you build in the crafting stations are world-placeable (like chests) but when you make them there's no placement interface, so you end up placing them down only vaguely where you want and with no control over the direction the objects are facing. Furthermore these objects can be knocked over and off surfaces by enemies but you walk right through them and cannot pick them up or adjust them to keep your base tidy.- The only way to unbuild structures it to tear them down and weapons (even stone swords) deal more structure damage than your basic clubs and hatchets, so as soon as you hit tin you'll end up using weapons for everything since they can harvest resources as well. I find this odd.- There are some issues with server hosting. Server privacy is almost nonexistent unless you set a password. Even when I set the game I was hosting to "friends only" I still had random strangers joining every now and then (not a lot of them, but even one is too many). On top of this there are very few things you can do as the host and none of the options are presented to you when starting to host your game, you have to find them in the options menu while playing.- Both the food you eat and the food you keep don't last long enough. Especially considering you're in a very cold area, meat should last longer than it does before spoiling (and there's nothing in the item details to tell you how long it lasts). On top of that everything you DO eat doesn't keep you going for long. If killing a boar the same size as myself only gives me one piece of meat then by golly that piece of meat should keep me going for at least a few days! Because of these issues you'll spend a lot of time hunting and foraging, unless you got lucky like me and had one wild boar after another wander straight into the abandoned village (seriously I killed more than ten of the things while just standing around working on building stuff).- Some things are intuitive, like the fact that you have to mine metals, but others aren't. When I wanted to get clay I had to google it, facepalming at the fact that I have to smash it out of rocks. Thankfully this only seems to be the case for a few items.- Creatures often go straight through rocks and other barriers that you have to go over/around. This is a real issue when you think you have that deer cornered and ripe for stabbing and he just vanishes into the rock face. This only seems ot happen with part of the rocks and I think they get stuck in there sometimes because they don't always come out the other side.- A minor gripe; I once found a compass and was annoyed that I had to hold it in my hand to tell direction. Normally it wouldn't be a bother but with so little inventory space the item wasn't worth the bother to take with me, so I dumped it. Extra equipment slots for things like this would be useful, and having them add a compass bar to the interface instead of holding up the object too. Furthermore as far as I can tell nobody from the abandoned settlements thought having a map would be a good idea despite apparently having enough paper to just leave lots of notes laying around. Even if there isn't a "you are here" marker on them, having some maps of each area to add to your journal and a compass bar would be really nice.- Another minor gripe; In character creation you can only create males, colours are limited to the realistic natural spectrum and half of the tattoos make the characters look like they are wearing t-shirts. Small things really, but I want to have a pink mohawk! D:<All in all I find it fun so far, just watch out for those skeletons, they're surprisingly quiet when they come up behind you!

content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								UPDATE:I'm keeping the game recommended for now, but I advise waiting for March to see if what they will reply to the community. The game might be abandonware, which would be a disgrace and it'd keep me from buying an Early Access ever again.A worthwhile Survival with dark fantasy props. A good buy at discount, and even a good bet on full price if you're into the genre.The game has plenty of  content (mobs, crafts, buildings, ores, trees, etc.) which is good for an EA. The atmosphere is enthralling, making those first hours really challenging when you need to get clothed, fed and find some shelter. At night you'll be on your toes, specially when those snow storms hit.The challenge then turns into finding bigger game to hunt, and trying not to get outmatched by your potential prey. Experience is much better with friends.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								This review is directed to the Devs. My friends and I love to play Savage Lands and relize it has some potential. We have some ideas of things we would love to see in upcoming updates. First off walking is a long and tiring proccess in Savage lands, in-game we have a main base camp with a town hall, forge, etc; but when we go hunting for food or going for minerals it is a lengthy proccess and it would be great if you could add mounts. In the way of mounts I was thinking that of course there should be horses, but why not have something more exciting? I don't know about you but I would personaly love to charge into battle atop my burly war bear to take out my enimies, or soar through the skies atop my dragon stead. I'm sure that you have heard this from lots of your players, but the map NEEDS to be larger. There is simply not enough to explore! I understand this game is relatively new, so for where it is this game is doing great. I reccomend this game to anyone willing to grind for materials for little reward other than to have them, and to survive in game. While I cannot say this game is a must-buy it should not be overlooked. So Devs I hope you have not overlooked this review and will take my ideas into consideration, and than you for providing hours of social fun with my friends.
