content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Day 1, completed the beginning guide to learn how to play, was great, saw this awesome sunset from my abode on the beach, I was able to chop down enough trees to build a shack even! It was awesome! I went into my shack at night to let the time pass, as I went to close the door some wolves decided they were hungry and I looked like a nice snack. Day 2, I decided to venture inland, as I was hunting deer and almost starving to death the nice dragon decided to end my suffering by eating me. 10/10 would do again.Day 3, I found a player town (yes I started on a server), they were nice enough to give me some food, bags, and armor, and I ventured back out into the wilderness to claim my own land! I had a nice shiny weapon now!!! I was hunting a deer when right as I ran up to attack it a bear came out of no where and decided to eat me and the deer. someone needs to teach these animals the "finders keepers" rule..Day 4, I'm running around yet again trying to find a nice place to live and I found this great area, I cleared out all the trees and shrubs, rebuilt my home and a great big fire to keep me warm, apparently the fire was too big because some skeletons decided they wanted to sit by the fire too so they wandered into my camp and proceeded to wreck me and take my camp.. what lovely gentlemen. All in all, this game is hilarious if you dont mind dying a few times to get the hang of things. Its been a very enjoyable experience thus far, will keep playing for sure if the game keeps updating!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Despite being a fairly blatant mix of skyrim's atmosphere and the popular minecraft survival style sandbox, I'd say this games worth a shot. Calling it what it is or not, the two things really mingle well. I feel this game has potential because of its difficulty, atmosphere, and pvp. Granted, early access, here are some things that could be improved upon:Dedicated servers and (Subsequently) raising the servers player cap far beyond 8.Being able to crouch, not just slow walk.  Smoothing of combat system, its not day z clunky but its still could use polishing.Optimization of graphics. I dont exactly have a great gaming computer, but for the quality of these graphics it shouldn't be as difficult to run smoothly as it seems. Im sure a lot of people also feel something is missing with no quests, dungeons, or any other true objectives besides survive and attempt to thrive with. However, I dont think it needs it. This could really be an interesting game if rather than copy/pasting the typical survival game mechanics, features, and far too many craftables, instead it took advantage of its multiplayer and gently encouraging players to make the most of an open world, realistic tribal, or even feudal, survival/ pvp warfare system. Something about this game just makes me yearn for that kind of experience.Overall, not bad. Gonna stick with it and see how it goes.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								I will admit that I haven't played many survival type games, I've played the more cutesie ones such as Terraria and Starbound, but nothing lik Savage Lands. I normally don't like games with the idea to survive and craft so hardcore in the beginning of the game, and normally not a fan of the first-person view either but that view has grown on me through other games played.I LOVE this game so far, could be that I play it with 1-2 other people though... All I know is that I enjoy the challenge and getting to explore while having to find your way back to your camp, etc. It's easy in the beginning with a camp built near the water, but after moving it more inland you really need to rely on a compass and different landmarks of sorts.Very interested in what changes will come about in the future, hoping perhaps the ability to craft a "recall potion" of sorts that can bring you back to your set spawn point is a possibility, but if not it's not too terribly hard to navigate yourself.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my first review on Steam and I'm going to keep it short.  This game is worth every penny and then some.  I've spent the last 2 years digging through survival games since I outgrew Minecraft.  There are a lot of garbage titles in the genre and that is a good thing as the best games easily rise to the top.  This is one of those gems for sure.  The most amazing thing is that this game isn't even remotely finished and it's already my fav game in the genre by far.  This is intended to become a Skyrim-survivalish game.  So at some point I'm going to be able to cast fireball spells?  Just take my money now.  My only regret is that I bought this game on sale for $8.00, and I really feel bad that the developers are not gettting the other $12.00 they had planned on.  I've never felt this way about a game and may in fact donate another 12 bucks just so I feel better about it.  Just buy this game... DO NOT watch streams or YouTube videos if you can help it.  The less you know, the more fun you will have.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have been very interested in this game since I first seen it pop up on EA... However, being against EA, I told myself I would wait quite a bit until purchasing.  Now that the game has been out for a bit and seeing tons of great reviews I decided to take the plunge. Very glad that I did.It constantly gets compared to Minecraft + Skyrim.  I wouldn't exactly say that is the hybrid I would go with, but I can see it.It is not a digging game or a block builder.  So dont get excited if that's what you love about Minecraft/Terraria.It isnt an action rpg.  There arent any NPCs. So if that what you like about Skyrim, then tough.What it is: Awesome.  You are washed up on a beach.  You find a few supplies that must've fallen off of your very tiny boat. You have 3 bars that you have to manage.  Cold. HP.  Hunger. All easily managable.  You start of with barely any inventory space... Logical because you washed up basically nude.You have to gather everything you can!  Build a fire to keep warm and cook meat from the various wild life you will have to kill. (Sorry Bambi lovers)  Make a house to stay safe at night (also keeps you warm).  Cutting down trees, and mining are your main resources, but with lots to explore and find washed up on shore or at various camps where others have perished.There are several types of enemies that require different tactics and better gear to "progress" while you try to gather materials and better your gear.And there is a giant dragon flying about!  This game is constantly getting updated.  The devs are constantly keeping the community in the loop and taking suggestions.  It seems like the devs want to keep this as realistic as possible but set within a fantasy world... I very much approve of this decision.  I really hope they dont end up taking advice from all of the casual complainers who want some modern-esque survival game.It is totally worth a pick up.  It isnt anywhere near finished but there is tons to do and lots to see.  I definitely think it is the type of game that one would enjoy to see evolve just as much as you would enjoy the game play.Note: I unfortunately have not given multiplayer a try, so I did not mention that in my review.  All I do know is there are 2 modes, one pvp and one thats pve co-op style.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok so I'm only about 8 hours in but I'm liking how things are going I'm just far enough that i feel safe adventuring at night alone or with a friend or two but still terrified of kur showing up and burning me to a crisp. Sadly I've yet to see any furies or giants, I'm guessing i just not far enough from the start area yet. Can't wait to fight some of the named enemies, planning to go looking for a few tonight. Things I'd like to seeWould be really nice if building a structure would level the terrain floor, would prevent dropped items from rolling outside under the walls and whatnot, not to mention the ground clipping through the floor of the townhalls.Ammo counter for the bow, yea i know u can put the arrows in the hotbar but after u use those 25 u can't tell how many more u have, not a big thing would just be semi helpful.Quiver bag, could only hold arrows but would let them stack to 100 intstead of 25 and have a few slots, could be a worn item maybe accessory slot, other accessories could be cloaks to help warm when in armor that isn't so warm. Epic teir item, after kur combat done could include a fireproof cloak made from kurs own hide.A block mechanic, shields would be nice but if i can block with my sword at least i wouldn't mind so much.Some type of cave/dungeon in game would be cool but I'm sure thats already been thought of.All in all the game is amazing so far and i can see myself playing plenty more in the weeks to come, I love that there is an update countdown in the main menu. I'd recommend this game to just about anyone who likes survival games it has just the right mix of grinding for items and fighting for your life that you'd hope for.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Good game. I mostly support it because they made Ascend: hand of Kul. Which I am QUITE angry to see has been removed. Forgot it existed. Randomly remembered it. Got super happy and felt life had purpose. Then find out it is no longer a thing. Angry.So i'm reviewing Ascend here, with some Savage lands added too.Ascend:Hand of Kul Review;Ascend: Hand of Kul is an action RPG hybrid putting you in the enormous shoes of a Caos—a monstrous being inhabiting the border between god and humanity. Customize your god-aspirant and join one of three factions determining your ability set: Dark, Void, or Light. Set out into a miserable landscape to defeat vile creatures, and harness their souls and experience. Convert altars scattered across the land to your deity, and recruit more worshipers to your god. Human followers will clamor onto your back and help defeat enemies with blazing arrows. Sacrifice yourself to the divine and create a homunculus to invade other player’s worlds and steal their altars. Upgrade your Caos through a huge library of gear, changing your play style and equipping yourself with the wardrobe of a god.    Ascend: Hand of Kul Key Features:3 factions - choose between Light, Dark and Void, each with their own play style and skillset.Equipment - customize your Caos with a huge arsenal of gear , unlocking new equipment as you play.Player invasion - Sacrifice yourself to the gods and send a homunculus in your image to attack other player’s realms.Recruit Followers - claim religious altars scattered through the world, recruiting human followers to aid you on your journey.Active Combat - fight in real time, chaining attacks to rack up combos and earn more souls.Savage Lands Review;Made by company that made Kuls hands. Is good. Play.

Posted: January 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								The game was fun, and I would reccommend it for those that like Dragons and survival games akin to Don't Starve. However my only complaint is regarding the very limited inventory space as well as limited stacking. Even if the meat is the same you can only have 1 raw meat of that type in a slot. To make a fire you need 3 logs but you can only have 2 per stack. Max inventory space is roughly 11 or 13 slots (can't recall at this time).   Other little annoyence is when you kill an animal it doesn't always give you meat. It would make sense to get a poorer quality of meat instead of none at all.    However please do not let these little annoying things stop you from trying the game.  I imagine you would thoroughly enjoy it with friends.   Highly recommend this game to be played with a good friend : )

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game when she first popped up on Steam then played it again just under a week ago. Actually I played it with a few friends on both occasions. To say the least, its fun, basic, and gives a decent enough challenge. In addition, after coming back to it, I'm impressed with the progress the dev's are making. Compared to the first time I played it, SL has made massive improvements. It's still a little wonky, hit boxes can be off, the AI will occasionally get confused and you'll see the rarer graphical glitch. However those are the negatives. I'm sure if you scroll through the comments you'll find the more nitpicking detailed issues that people have. However, for a $15 early access indie multiplayer, Savage Lands stands out. It has a comprehensive UI and crafting system, a time consuming yet entertaining grinding system, the graphics and AI are still well built for what it is. Does it have it's problems? Sure, yet like I said it's an early access indie (that's only $15) and for that I give it a 10/10. Also the Devs are still here! (ikr, rare AF) Is it worth the money? Absolutely! Especially if you're going to play with friends. You get to set up your own servers, its savable, and it easy AF to set up.How is SL compared to other Indies/Alphas? It's simple, it doesn't compare. I mean that in a good way. This game hit the nail on the head for me. Nowadays you have to sort through all the glitchy PoS waste of money multiplayers, Indies, and or Alphas that Steam has to offer. All so you can find a remotely decent one to play with friends. Even then, most are pay to win or the Dev's give up on them after the first couple of months, and or the Dev/Devs just run off with the money *cough cough Dean Hall*. In conclusion, seeing as I'm starting to rant. Overall Savage Lands is still a very solid game and in my opinion it is a load of fun and definitely worth the money.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Incredibly fun, crafting and harvesting feels good,  fighting is a combo of archery, dodging, and blocking and feels super satisfying with the many different kinds of weapons. Most of the reviews say that mining sucks and takes forever, it takes like 30 seconds to mine a fair amount of tin and coal (important resources early game) with a rock ._. Pretty sure everyone who is submitting reviews about mining speed either never upgraded their hammer or just decided to try and skip progression and mine the highest tier stuff with a rock. If you follow the progression mining takes almost no time at all.Additionally, the game features randomly occuring bosses and unique items, makes it feel a little like first person terraria, especially with the game's focus on PVE.TLDR: if you are a KOSing scrub from rust,dayz,etc go elseware, this is PVE (E FOR EVIRONMENT, NOT PLAYER), if you remember playing games like terraria with your friends fondly, you will probably like this alot. Totally recommend the game, especially for the current price on humble bundle (<$6.00 with other games in a bundle)

Got super happy and felt life had purpose. Then find out it is no longer a thing. Angry.So i'm reviewing Ascend here, with some Savage lands added too.Ascend:Hand of Kul Review;Ascend: Hand of Kul is an action RPG hybrid putting you in the enormous shoes of a Caos—a monstrous being inhabiting the border between god and humanity. Customize your god-aspirant and join one of three factions determining your ability set: Dark, Void, or Light. Set out into a miserable landscape to defeat vile creatures, and harness their souls and experience. Convert altars scattered across the land to your deity, and recruit more worshipers to your god. Human followers will clamor onto your back and help defeat enemies with blazing arrows. Sacrifice yourself to the divine and create a homunculus to invade other player’s worlds and steal their altars. Upgrade your Caos through a huge library of gear, changing your play style and equipping yourself with the wardrobe of a god.    Ascend: Hand of Kul Key Features:3 factions - choose between Light, Dark and Void, each with their own play style and skillset.Equipment - customize your Caos with a huge arsenal of gear , unlocking new equipment as you play.Player invasion - Sacrifice yourself to the gods and send a homunculus in your image to attack other player’s realms.Recruit Followers - claim religious altars scattered through the world, recruiting human followers to aid you on your journey.Active Combat - fight in real time, chaining attacks to rack up combos and earn more souls.Savage Lands Review;Made by company that made Kuls hands. content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								I purchased this game a year ago. To see the amount of content and updates they've done since then is nothing but astonishing. They have upgraded the graphics quite a bit. They've added so much land mass it is easy to get lost, but that's a good thing.They've added bosses, several of them. They've also added unique/named weapons you can find or loot. The crafting in this game is awesome. This is very similar to The Forest in the way of gameplay. One of the few things lacking are gates for the fences, as well as being able to freely build your own structures. So far you have to choose different buildings and set them down and then add the resources to complete them. I highly recommend this game. As much as they've worked on it since last year, I look forward to what is next to come.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								After a shipwreck I woke up in a beach of some unknow place. I found traces of living people there. Huts, gathered food and even some much needed tools. But I saw nobody. I took their things hoping they could one day forgive a man doing what he needs to survive.Along the shore there were a couple campfires, but I lacked the resources to light them up. Or maybe I did, but didn't want to use them just for the sake of seeing fire. At least not yet. The cold winds never cease their attacks on me.Leaving the sand behind, I adventured to the wilderness. Abundant pine trees waved welcomes to me and I welcomed some deers - I mean, running food AND resources. I've never imagined I would kill a living creature with my own hands, but it happened and I am alive now because of that. Later I found a village. Finally! I was excited to see signs of real civilization closing in on the horizon as I dashed with all of what was left of my strength. Not a single living creature. And that meant two things:1- The people who lived here either left or died.2- Some of those who stayed behind (and died) are not very found of foreigners.So I had to face skeletons armed with just a stone axe. Luckly, they were in a shape far worse than mine. The sun left my world, the cold snow masked everything in a beautiful and deadly white and my mind wondered what would happen to me if I were to perish here. Would I become one of them?I didn't feel good. I could say I felt the heat leaving my body, but there weren't even traces of it in me. I've heard of peopple who froze to death. What happened to them. The blurry sight, weakness, shaking. The air was ice and it burnt my lungs with every breath. I couldn't go much further. But even before my fall, I witnessed a gigantic winged craeture soaring the skies.I died then. It was my first day. But somehow I was there again. The familiar beach. I don't understand this. Is it hell? Am I condemned to freeze to death every day? I hope not. I don't think so. What the devils don't know is that I am getting better, adapting, learning to survive and I will have my revenge.__________________________________________Think of this game as hardcore minecraft. You struggle to survive and have to juggle your health, hunger, cold, explorations, building, crafting and resource hunting. Good luck!Oh, and get a friend to play it with you.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands, at first sight i pictured another average survival spin-off but this game is actually very original in a lot of ways. Its fun and challenging which adds to the over satisfaction its not just stupidly difficult gameplay on top of impossible  odds. The devs from what i hear are very very interested in user feedback and keep diologue rolling with many gamers which is exactly how it should be. I love the crafting and building system, it gives you the feeling the island is yours for the taking and truly it is. The only downside is as you start reaching out for minerals and expanding you get the feeling the island is very small. However even though the island is small by my standards it is packed with action you cant walk for 30 seconds without seeing some form of life. Nightfall is another fun addition i wish it was darker making the torch an absolute necessity but we'll see where they go with it. Some users say its too difficult i find that to be untrue. Just remember survivors, preparation is everything. dont go out fighting forest giants in your skivvies with a rock tied to a stick.

								This game has a really awesome and unique feel to it, as others have said. it’s bleak, but that just adds to the feel for me, makes you feel very isolated. The whole lore is cool to, and the crafting system seems pretty solid, not to hard to craft stuff, but not hours of grinding hard either.  	Basically, it’s visually appealing, not the best graphics ever but the environment is epic. The combat system is okay. As it is a survival game it’s top notch keeping you interested in a deep world. The game seems to be advancing well, with good updates frequently, and a good team running it. This game has some serious potential.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								I am really enjoying this! Haven't really gotten into survival games in the past, but I decided to try this out with my boyfriend and am really enjoying it! It is addicting! Of course, I really hope they add in a female option, I would really like to play as one, but that doesn't take away from the game at all. I really like the crafting system, it is user-friendly and you can make some really cool stuff. Also like how you build, you choose a building, for example a stone house, then pick where you want it. Once placed, it is a simple outline of what the house will look like, then you interact with it and add in the materials needed. If you don't have all the materials, you go out and find stone/wood/etc and then go back and add it to the house. It really feels like you are carrying building materials to a site, kinda life-like. As you add in the materials needed, the building starts to be fleshed out, and once you're done it is complete. I am also enjoying the updates/patches, its interesting to see the game evolve and improve from the first version I played. Also the development team is very involved with the fans and take into consideration everyones comments/suggestions and what players want in the game.Great survival game!

Early Access Review
								This game may have potential, but initial impressions are not all that good. The graphics are lame, granted, I'm sure there are a lot of place holders, but still, lame all around. Combat is pedestrian and I'm beginning to think these slow moving, open world, survival games just aren't for me. The Elder Scroll games however hold my attention much more. I only bought Savage Lands because it's currently on sale, I'm so glad I didn't pay full price. I don't usually buy Early Access games, but I do think it's important to support the games that have potential. I'm going to recommend this game anyway, purely due to it's potential, but please know that it is very much still in development. I'm giving the developers the benefit of the doubt and have faith they will bring it up to AAA level.Pros:+ Frequent updates from the devs+ Devs active on the forum, open to feedback+ Potential as an open world survival/action game+ Ability to craft shelter, supplies, etc.+ DragonCons:- Lame Graphics- Pedestrian Combat- Filled with mundane tasks like collecting rocks- Mediocre menu design- Lack of controller support

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								I am generally fairly skeptical about recommending a game that is in early access, but I would say that this game is worth the $19.99 (and definitely worth it while on sale) right now.The game is very harsh, you can die to hungry and freezing. You can die from packs of wolves (or even the solo wolves right in the beginning). As you collect materials you can upgrade your gear (i.e. better armor and weapons).The melee combat system *feels* very rewarding currently, it is a little easy to sidestep and run around some monsters, but you can almost feel the swing of a weapon. I am not a huge fan of the bow in the game, mainly due to the large arc (I feel the arrow should arc a bit slower than it is currently, but am confident the devs will find a happy medium somewhere).I would say the best part of the game is the sound, it is extremely immersive. You can hear the wilderness, everything just sounds great. All of the mobs have distinct sounds, deer wander through the forest making huge ruckuses. You will probably not hear wolves until it is too late, and the howl of the plagued wolf before it pounces will literally send a shiver down my spine.There are a few issues, mainly not having floors in buildings so you need to find very flat land to build and the mobs not interacting with each other in any meaningful way.Obviously the game is still Early Access, and you have to be prepared for some bugs, but the game is in a very playable state and looks to be a great foundation to build a truly epic game.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game was a little difficult at first...kept dying every few minutes till I got the mechanics of "surviving" down. Key was to stay calm and patient, and "think" it out, which is what I really like best about the game. Rather than just keystrokes and repetitive actions, you have to strategize what you're doing to make real progress. I've discovered the five main towns of the island and monolith and had some lethal interactions with the "wild" life  LOL but have improved my hunting skills considerably since first starting the game. My advice, play with a friend, be patient, and give the game a chance...it becomes addictive pretty fast. Still lots of bugs that need tweaking but programmers seem to be going through that list little by little. Some realistic features are in place, while things like needing water to survive and being able to tear down already made wooden structures for kindling and making fires, or just removing them isn't in place yet. But like I said...solid game, looking forward to final edition.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								So far so good, its alot like Forest , except so far not so creepy as Forest , Forest really creeps me out. Although it has become better in the latest updates. I will def post a  more informative review when I have a few more hours in it. I died once when I went outside to smoke and didnt pause it so not sure what killed me.Then I had ZERO cold bar left when I managed to get the fire lit....I do like the sounds and the ambience , the devs did well on that.O now that I have some time in it, I definitely like it. I also find I enjpoy it much more than Forest. Not that I dont like Forest because I def do. It is just a bit on the frustrating side. This game gives me a feeling of accomplishment and I feel it is doable. I guess my only complaints so far is it is so hard to maintain a sense of direction and you can get lost quickly. Also it would be nice to have a mouse sensitivity adjustment as I feel like Im drunk when I play and would love to be able to slow the mouse movement down. I did on my end but in game is still far too sensitive.Right now I have to add that a save game function would be nice. If you exit the game u go back to where u were at that moment but if you die you are dropped on the beach and have to run like hell to wherever your corpse is to retrieve your accumulated gear. But maybe this adds to the game in some way. I did find an entire village the last time I died on the way back to my corpse, sadly 2 wolves found me before I could get back.

Also it would be nice to have a mouse sensitivity adjustment as I feel like Im drunk when I play and would love to be able to slow the mouse movement down. I did on my end but in game is still far too sensitive.Right now I have to add that a save game function would be nice. If you exit the game u go back to where u were at that moment but if you die you are dropped on the beach and have to run like hell to wherever your corpse is to retrieve your accumulated gear. But maybe this adds to the game in some way. I did find an entire village the last time I died on the way back to my corpse, sadly 2 wolves found me before I could get back.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is the first game that I have played so far that has caused me to actually be wary of nightfall. This has a Dark Souls-esque feel to it in that it is not easy to progress, but each little milestone makes it worthwhile. It can be a little systematic in that you gather, build, gather, build, wait for night to finish, then repeat in the beginning stages of the game (I'm still there now), but that dragon likes to remind me that I'll have to get a little more adventurous when I'm better equipped.On the very first night, I was attacked by a canine (still trying to figure out what kind of mob it was) and killed. That was a wake-up call, if there ever was one. Be careful; pay attention to the different sounds you hear. But, I'm a fan of this, just for that fact. To be honest, the beginning in this game is a lot harder than the beginning of Dark Souls. I might be too early in the game to actually tell, but from what I see, the most there is for weather is snow and clear skies. I think it would be nice to have other conditions, such as rain and thunderstorms. Maybe even add different seasons into the game, with each season having signature weather? All in all, I'm a fan of the game so far, and I'm only a few hours into it.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								If anything, you will see "has potential" in many reviews and they are all right.  Savage Lands screams potential and the progress that has been made so far is excellent.They patch often, they talk with their community and clearly there is a passion to push new features and ideas.Pros: -Nice open world that really immerses you into the idea that this is a nasty, cold, bitter and deadly place.      -The Day and Night cycle.  Learn to fear the night      -Crafting system       -Mulitplayer ( coop with friends of FFA servers with potential non-friends :P )      -There be giants and dragons..oh yes! ( and undead, nasty wolves, yummy boars )Cons:  Since early alpha they have improved the UI, performance and crash issues with zeal and while there are still FPS isses near water and some weather clipping effects, from a performance stand-point the game is running well for my rig which is 2.5 years old.   I know you already know this but again, this is Early Access, so this is more of a "love to have" list rather than a product critique      The main CON is features and content      LOVE to have sooner than later     -repair buildings when I find them     -repair my own armor     -upgrade buildings ( AKA: Skyrim )     -oil/fat as a resource to make lamps for internal lighting of houses     -dungeons     -Larger structures like enemy castles ( NPC or player controlled )     -Build walls     -Furniture such as a Bed and then being allowed to sleep through the nightThe list goes on but those are the top ones for me.All in all I've had a blast playing and dying, and dying and....running for my life freezing to death with undead chasing me in a snow storm at night.It's fun!

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Well, i have to say that so far i am pleasantly pleased with the game. It adds some suspense, and keeps you on the move to survive, at least for the first while so far, although i am only into it for just over an hour at this point. The odd thing can be found but for the most part its a fairly balanced grind to find the items needed to craft improved weapons and armor, of which they are fairly diverse in visuals, which is nice to see. You dont have infinite storage, you really have to earn your stoarge capacity from what i can see, so be choosy on what you pick up or need to keep, as bag space will keep you working until you have crafted some good quality packs, and some storage lockers. Its got a nice older gritty feel to its graphics, yes its not the be all end all, but im more into immersion from my games. That leads me to sounds, they have done well, directional and atmospheric audio, you can actually get warnings of directions you may not wish to go, or you may find that illusive deer by its call. A good headset will allow you to avoid, or go right to, the spot you need to.The server sizes are small, and its easy to work together, as opposed to the KOS style of larger servers where everyone feels they have to fight eachother to survive. This seems more oriented toward a group based survival againt the elements, nature, and mythology :)I haven't run into anything gamebreaking or glitching, so far everything works well, and its just a matter of time til i can progress to where i feel safe and secure in the game, so i will definately keep playing this one and give it my approval. Looking forward to playing with a few of you soon.

content:

Early Access Review
								Difficult and frustrating, the goals and targets in the game are constantly being moved. It's like the game designers are building it just for themselves, a private club. You die - a lot - for no other reason than bad luck. And there are so many chances that you have to take. You can't save a game and to die, even if you've cached stuff, is to lose everything. So you end up playing conservatively. You don't take risks, so exploration is in a way discouraged. I suppose if you keep at it you'll get somewhere. There are a lot of smug players in forums to seem to feel that way, but I found it to be all so frustrating that I didn't keep at it. The highest I ever got was to build a smithy, then they regened the game and deleted my character and I had to start all over again.

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Tremendous promise here, but not much to see yet. You have far too little control over your success / failure. You will die a lot. Dying often in survival games is usual and customary; the problem here is that long stretches of accomplishing and learning next to nothing are punctuated by the relentless death / respawn cycle. Soon enough, you're going to find yourself looking at the clock, wondering why there's so little happening.Navigation is virtually impossible. If you start on the beach and cannot fix your position within a minute or two: give up. Leave whatever bits you've found lying in a pile on the beach and then walk directly into the icy surf to drown yourself. On the subsequent respawn, try again. Exploring new stretches of beach is pointless. You will usually spend the entire time it takes to die of exposure, walking down barren stretches of sand without finding _any_ supplies or crafting materials.Armour doesn't last nearly as long as it takes to collect the materials to craft it. You will spend most of your time sporting a ragged loincloth and worn flint axe, running away from wolves. Fun for a bit! Really. But it doesn't get better.Most combat triggers a bleeding condition, but there's no cloth to be found to craft bandages. Your avatar will simply stand there and watch himself bleed until he falls over, dead.Gathering materials for crafting: forests without sticks, boulder fields without stones, plains without edible plants.Most crafting recipes require a forge ... and you can't make a forge. But! There's a forge in the first town: Argo. However, you'll need post-introductory gear (read: crafted with non-trivial materials and a forge) or tremendous luck to survive long enough to find Argo. A vicious chicken-and-egg joke, shot through with the soon-to-be-all-too-familiar pointless death / respawn cycle.</sigh.>I'll be back. Again: tremendous promise here, but it's just not ready. Even for the players that are willing to endure much to support and explore indie survival games.

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Skyrim meets Darks Souls meets Don't Starve.  One of the main reasons why this game is getting bad reviews right now is people can't handle the steep learning curve.  This game is made to be difficult and being so early in development isn't making the difficulty any easier.  So if you buy this game, expect a challenge.Now with all that in mind this game is still very early access so there are things that really don't make any sense like the deersharks and the fact that you can't craft forges, but these are all things that they already plan on fixing.  If you decide to buy this game expect issues, expect to be annoyed at the quirks, but also be pleasantly surprised at the amount of regular developer feedback.If Signal and Digital DNA Games keeps up this level of feedback (weekly streams and Q&A's) and development continues at roughly the same pace as it's been up to now this will be a very solid title.  With Digital DNA's history on Xbox, the fact that they continued development on games like Castleminer and Castleminer Z for years after they were released and even going so far as to try to bring CMZ to the PC I have full confidence that this title will get just as much dedication.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Given that this was an early access title, I went into it with low expectations.  But even those expectations were too much.  The art, the playable content, the direction, even the setting... none of it is finished.  And while that may be fine (After nearly two years of development), if the core mechanics underlying it all just worked.  But they don't.  The screenshots are in no way indicative of the actual gameplay.  While the graphics and much of the setting is represented, many of the basic models or concepts (group mobs for instance) don't exist in the game.  Overall, the game starts out slightly difficult due to poor gameplay prompts.  It then falls into being one of the easiest games I've ever played.  Until you get to the end game content, at which point you'll no longer have any hope of even slightly progressing without a fully geared multiplayer party to join you.  You'll also lose your progress.  Frequently.  To stuck characters, to unaccessable places, to inescapable enemies who plant their flag in your dead♥♥♥♥♥to prevent you from recovering anything. And you'll consistantly lose everything to unexplainable bugs where your corpse just disappears on respawn.  This developer has a cheap one-size html template website.  They have no real discussion boards or discord, a poorly run trello that doesn't in any way fit the role of a project tracker, and they seemingly have no direction at all with the project.  It's already gone through one major overhaul and platform upgrade, and has still yet to see major setting changes.  And this is after nearly two years of development?  I understand not being done, but it's not even close.  And after this long in development, the only excuses are incompetance, mismanagement, and plain ♥♥♥♥ery.  Don't buy this game in early access.  Wait to see if it ever gets done first.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game a long time ago (year or two?) and have started to play again with a new character in the updated, expanded world.  I enjoyed it before, but there was much to expand on and complete still.  I'm really happy to see that it's not been given up on like some other early access games sometimes are.  This game has a lot of promise and has become a blast to explore and build in.I play on my own and with my partner and it's been one adventure after another - trying to survive, trying to build, trying to explore, and hunting new nodes, beasts, and being hunted by even bigger things yet - "Just wait 'til I get my next gear upgrade, pesky critters!"  It's explorational, keeps you on your toes, and challenging without levels while encouraging cautious bravery so that you may conquer that which you've discovered.I didn't take much time to write this review and shall likely update it later, but I just wanted to send good will toward this game as the creators continue working on it to make it what it is meant to be. Safe travels, fellow exiles!

								i bought this for 7.99 and it is ealsily one of the better survile titles out there. it starts off in much the same manner as ark, on a beach with no cloths or tools, the added challenge here is that you are in a tundra as opposed to a dinosaur filled jungle. the lack of dinos would make this game's enimies easier save for the presence of at least one dragon. overall, if you were to take the story, freindly npcs and overpowered gear in skyrim and replace them with a fairly challenging but still fun survival mechanic, signifigantly stronger enemies, and a crushing sence of lonelyness, you would have a clone of this game.oh yeah and multiplayer...there's that too.

Early Access Review
								Fun survival game. You can see that it is made by just a few people. It might get repetitive at some point, but for now it's tons of fun. I won't tell you what the game is about because you can Google that. I will however tell you that it is worth at least 15 euros. This game is difficult! You will die, you will fail. However, when you've figured out the mechanics, it is tons of fun.The only thing I would wish for is more content: more blueprints (houses, walls, traps), more enemies, more fighting patterns and I would love to see skills added to this game. I have been playing with friends, which I can advise, but you can perfectly solo this game as well.So, looking for a difficult (indie) survival game? This is for you.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands is a work in progress, but it is worth your support.  You start play naked and alone on a hostile shore.  Your health declines due to the cold, and you need to eat to maintain stamina so you can run.  When you start out, the learning curve is steep and it takes a while before you get the hang of things, so you die, respawn and go and retreive your lost gear and try try again.  The game is unforgiving, and that is the charm of it.  If it were easy you would get bored of it very quickly.  To the Devs credit they are responsive and hands on and release changes ever week or two in my experience.  This is not Skyrim, it is its own beast, but frankly it has things that Skyrim would have benefitted from such as there being a point to eating and staying warm.  By the time this game is finished I think it will be pretty excellent.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								So, my friends and I played this game for about 5 or so hours. We started small, built a shelter, found each other, one built houses, another gathered food, and another mined, and another did a bit of everything.It was really fun, we enjoyed playing the game, but we knew this was early access so we can't complain over a lack of content. We can't wait until we can actually fight the dragon as that mother fudger was chasing us everytime we ventured in land.Yet again, it is early access but the combat between players is VERY dodgy. The lag at times is very... crippling.I would recommend this game and I can't wait to see how it changes over time. Also, challenge for you - fight a bear with your bare hands ;v

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								After nearly getting grilled by the dragon, I decided to call it a draw and concentrate on hunting bears.Then I got surprise-shagged by a bear for killing two of his pals.Respawned on the other side of the island in a shack in a very hostile area, got ambushed by 3 packs of wolves.Respawned again and got grilled by the dragon.Respawned and made it really far, then a pack of wolves jumped out of the bushes and decided to cuddle with me.10/10, would respawn again. (Tip: Place the pike in your house on the shore. Really.)Now, to ze serious part;• I like the inventory, it's organized nicely and for the most part it's also responding well• It's great that you're right away from the beginning thrown into having to survive with nothing at your hands, exept the stuff you find.• I'm glad this is in 1st-person. You're sneaking around in the forest and you have to look left and right; stop walking and listen to the sounds, trying to figure out if it comes closer and from which direction.  It makes the anxiety about being alone in this hostile environment much more atmospheric and cooler.Some random ideas;• Crafting a map from leather hides for example, that you can draw on (No auto-map).• Deconstructing weapons/tools/equipment that you no longer need and getting a few materials back.• What about planting trees and bushes with the berries or the nuts? Would be fun to have a bit of a somewhat constant source for food for now and then.Weird things;• I couldn't stack things in the box that you can craft.   If you try to drag one stack to the other one (like 8 stones to 4), it simply drops the one in the chest to the ground. Would be great if that could be changed.• There were a couple of times deers and wolves bugging on trees or bushes (They were rapidly turning from one side to the other, until I approached them so they'd run away).I enjoyed the game a lot so far and am interested in seeing how it will develop until it's ready for release~Defenitely worth a try, if you like that kind of games! Keep in mind though, it's still Early Access.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Given that this was an early access title, I went into it with low expectations.  But even those expectations were too much.  The art, the playable content, the direction, even the setting... none of it is finished.  And while that may be fine (After nearly two years of development), if the core mechanics underlying it all just worked.  But they don't.  The screenshots are in no way indicative of the actual gameplay.  While the graphics and much of the setting is represented, many of the basic models or concepts (group mobs for instance) don't exist in the game.  Overall, the game starts out slightly difficult due to poor gameplay prompts.  It then falls into being one of the easiest games I've ever played.  Until you get to the end game content, at which point you'll no longer have any hope of even slightly progressing without a fully geared multiplayer party to join you.  You'll also lose your progress.  Frequently.  To stuck characters, to unaccessable places, to inescapable enemies who plant their flag in your dead♥♥♥♥♥to prevent you from recovering anything. And you'll consistantly lose everything to unexplainable bugs where your corpse just disappears on respawn.  This developer has a cheap one-size html template website.  They have no real discussion boards or discord, a poorly run trello that doesn't in any way fit the role of a project tracker, and they seemingly have no direction at all with the project.  It's already gone through one major overhaul and platform upgrade, and has still yet to see major setting changes.  And this is after nearly two years of development?  I understand not being done, but it's not even close.  And after this long in development, the only excuses are incompetance, mismanagement, and plain ♥♥♥♥ery.  Don't buy this game in early access.  Wait to see if it ever gets done first.

Early Access Review
								Mixed Bag. I'm missing some rather basic things like clothes (why can't I make a warm jacket out of the wolfs pelt?), instead there''s a ton of weird armour. Same with the structures, I can make useless armour stands, but I can't make a fence? or a palisade?Some things are also very cheap, some others extremely expensive: chests or bows. Basically anything that needs sinews, because they're actually rare (a beast should maybe drop half a dozen of those, instead of the maybe one). The option to turn a whole hide into 3 sinews isn't really helping. You'd expect a lot more of them from a whole hide. Speaking of hide, why do I need one for a hammer? and so on. Seems rather unbalanced (and grindy) right now.Engine-wise, and from the look and feel of it, the game feels quite good.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I just played this game and I'm going to tell you this and this only, do NOT buy this game even if you have great hardware. This game is not optimized at all and has several issues in which, from my experience, your frames per second in your video will NOT change. Whether it be from the lowest settings or the highest settings, my fps stays at around 11-13. Now as I said, this is from my experience, but that does not mean that you will be immune to it. I have relatively mid-high end hardware and your experience will be rather lacking with the object glitches coupled with lighting and sound latency. I had only played this game for 10 minutes, trying to ignore the poor optimization and performance issue, and I also want to note that the gameplay on it seemed rather bland as well.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
Early Access Review
Savage LandsRecently exiled from my homeland, I find myself washed up on a beach, in a land filled with chilling cold winds. Nothing in this new place seems familiar.Maybe - just maybe - I could find shelter from this cold wind.Nothing seems as I remember, this new land is harsh, cold and savaged. Even the wildlife here seems to be savaged. Last time I went in land, I was chased by a fierce wolf, I barely made it out of there alive. Had it not been for my Frost fern bandage, I would surely have succumbed from the bleeding from the wound the wolf left as a gift on my right leg.Now all I really want to do is to stay alive, even if it means that I have to find shelter somewhere around the beach.At least then I can always have a lookout on ships sailing by here. Unfortunately, I have yet to spot any ships coming this way.The snow storm is still raging outside of my hut, so for now at least - all I can do is sit tight in here. However, I should probably get a plan going, seeing as it seems I will be stuck on this ravaged land for a long time. The cooked wolf meat are soon running out, and I think I spotted a few deer roaming a little further away from the hut. I might go out tomorrow and see if I can at least hunt one of the deer. Now is probably a good time to get some rest so I have a little strength for tomorrows hunting.Later that night a strange roar is heardWhat is that? That certainly did not sound like any sound I heard before. Could it be people using some kind of horn? Nay, I have yet to see anyone around here. Frankly I think I am all alone for now.As I wander outside, looking around - left, right, back and forth. I hear a faint flapping of wings. I brace myself, ready to seek shelter in the hut again. As I turn my head slowly, I notice the shadow on the ground in front of me.Holy smoke! A Dragon! I could have sworn these were only occurring in the folk tales. Stories told to children to keep the from going out at night. But right now, this shadow is roaming around my hut. Look at the size of that thing, it's almost 13 meters long, with a wing span of at least three tall men.I run back into the hut, panting and sweating at the sight of the fierce creature.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								before the last update on 8\9\16 the game was alot of fun but also hard. now there are less creatures in the world but it is a glitch they are going to fix hopefully in the next update (whenever that is) for those of you thinking about getting this game if you enjoyed skyrim then the setting of this game is very much like that. tho it is a survival game/ adventure game.you start off on the small island of Snowmere. this is the beginning island. some of the mobs will kill you pretty easily at first but as you progress and build up your gear and base they get easier to hunt down.after you feel like you are geared up enough you can progress to the second island of Freydalyn. the island of Freydalyn is much much much bigger then the island of Snowmere. it is also set into 2 stages the first stage is the half of the island you start on while the second stage is the other half. i say stages because of the kinds of gear you can make and the creatures to kill on each half of the island. after a bit of time on the second island gearing up and killing mobs its time to go explore the third island. if you head to the faaaaar northern part of the island of Freydalyn you will come across a town, go ahead and explore i wont tell you how to get to the third island tho, just like i didnt tell you how to get to the second because exploring is half the fun ;)the third island is the island of Jormungahr (i know, i cant pronunce it either) this is the third and final (so far) island. on the island of Jormungahr, it is as close to hell as this game gets (lol) be ready to get killed at any second and always remember to RUN LIKE HELL. the mobs on this island WILL kill you. this third island is the hardest out of all three. its size is in between the sizes of the other 2 island. but dont be fooled by its size it is many times harder then both other islands put together. on the third island you can also get the best gear (if you survive long enough) and fight and hopefully kill the dragon ( no idea if he respawns tho but i think he does) by killing the dragon you can get dragon gear and wyrmslayer weapons but hes no push over. have fun, happy hunting and most of all beware the trees.

Early Access Review
								Fun, good concept, it's an early access game on steam...I haven't played this game for very long but it's pretty fun. If you are into the first person terraria type games then go for it but it's an unfinished early access game on steam that might never be finished... I have had no problems running this game and my friend that has a terrible PC can run it just fine so I would say it's decently optimized. This is basically a skyrim mixed with minecraft type of game. It's fun once you get into it but it's only fun with friends. I would say you are better off getting Rust. It's cool that you can make your own server and play either by yourself or with friends. They are updating the game lots more and there is much more to come.Rating: 6.5/10

content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								You know how you're worried about all the early access games just releasing wayyy too early, and unsure if it will ever continue development? This game feels like it had 2 months of development, then released. The concept is fun and addictive, like a co-op survival morrowind (not really rust x skyrim)Except, youre on an island with trees and rocks. You can build crap melee weapons, attack seletons and get nothing from them. Attack wolves and deers. Cant really build or make anything much, nothing really to explore.Oh and the bears, oh god the bears.The hitboxes are INSANELY BAD, it looks like an enemy is standing 5 meters infront of you, and then they swing and hit you. The bears...the bears swing at you from 10 meters, and when you walk up to hit them, you automatically collide and push them back even further, whilst they still swing at you. Theres nothing to this game. Extremely rushed cash grab. I hope it turns into a sruvival dungeon crawler one day.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								So far this has proven to be a very interesting game for me personally. It combines a lot of elements that I like from other games, but the devs still have work to do so maybe if you are on the edge about purchasing then keep your eye on it.If I were to sum up the feel of this game I would say it is very similar to Skyrim while taking a lot of elements from games such as Minecraft and Don't Starve. Essentially its a big sandbox with skyrim like feel and a lot of its own fun elements.Be warned however, right now the game does not seem to be very well optimized so expect frame drops if you aren't running a high end computer.There is no story, but a lot of the landmarks and actually geography is really cool-- stuff you really can't get from randomly generated worlds.

								I'd like to start off by saying that I really enjoyed this game when I first started playing it for what feels like almost 2 years ago. Now the game is still under development, past its expected release date. The new big island they've been working on apears to be in beta for almost 2 months now, and It almost seems like the game is dying. As of recent I've played 7 Days to Die, which is like 20 times better in comparrisan to this survival game. Crafting is better, construction is better (because its based on a block system instead of premade structures). Survival mode is better. I just want to say that originally I was really looking forward to this game being released but now I'm not so sure. If you want to spend your money on a good survival game, buy 7d2d not this buggy garbage.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								So far this game is fun and sets itself apart from the other survival games with more of a fantasy feel to it. It’s harder and scarier than the rest (wolves -_-)  and that’s awesome. Bugs are easy to find only ANY early access game, one in particular that was annoying was dead creatures still making sounds… but it’s early access so pointing them all out in review is dumb. Max graphics could look better vegetation-wise especially on the trees since they look a little low poly. I hope to see more customization with the buildings and a craftable forge >.< unless I missed something; however, the weapons and armors are awesome! However, crafting certain items is a pain (like the hatchet) but you can still beat down a wolf with your barefists like a true man to get your sinew. This is a good early access game I do hope the dev team continues to update this game. It has a lot of potential… If you’re looking for a perfect game that gives you cookies don’t buy. If you’re looking for a game that’s different, fun, and is a little challenging to the average gamer… get it. Else – try the regular zombie or rust style survival games... GLHF

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Everyone has that one game that makes them wish Steam had a neutral rating, and this one is mine.I love the concept, and when playing it, it was actually quite fun. The issues are primarily in the playerbase, or lack thereof, so I'm going to be recommending this game for that (a negative rating is no way to gain players).Of course, there was one issue with the game itself I had. Progression feels a little bit off. There's a checklist of things you need to do, which is great, really gives you an idea of what you need to do. Of course, it gets kind of annoying when there's camps and towns absolutely EVERYWHERE giving you things you shouldn't have anywhere near as early as you get them. This could easily be fixed by lowerint the spawn rate on them (perhaps even making it some sort of slider when generating a world, to add or decrease difficulty). But with things like this everywhere, it seems pointless to make anything on your own.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								   I think it is a grate game for now, it still has work being put into it which is good. I want to ask of a few things first from the developers and then tell my expereince. If you could add a bed in the one of the next update that would be nice, i think it should add warmth and pass time by 6-8 hours. I also would like it if you could add in to where you could tame a young wolf with dear meat to have a pet, i think that would be cool.    Now from what i have experience, this game is a lot of survival and crafting. You, as said in other reviews, begin washed up on shore of the Sundreaded Isle with basic supplies at your disposal. Im glad that you give us basic stuff, that is good, other games throw you in without a tutorial or tools. You start with a cured flint axe, basic cloth clothing(replace as soon as possible) and a sac with food. you can biuld more sacs to  carry more, and you unlock more recipeies as you craft.    My advice would be to experiment with crafting and see what you get, you can only learn threw trial and error.  Also try to make a basic house(wooden shack) before night fall if you plan to move inland, you will need it for a retreat if attacked at night, i think you should stay around the shore for about 1-3 days and gather supplies on your first try. Again this game is in alpha so expect some thing to not work out so well, like how wooden logs have a tendency to roll threw everything. I do like this game and see lots of potential in it, but agian please take my requests of a bed and taming young wolves into thought.     One more thing, if you do plan to go inland on your first run, try to complete the beta objectives first so you can get a basic understanding of how the game works and try to get a bow or sword as soon as possible, there is village near the dragons tower with a forge you can use to craft till you biuld your own, just avoid the dragon if you can. That is all i have for now. I hope it was of some use to whoever reads it.

content:
Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								I'd like to start off by saying that I really enjoyed this game when I first started playing it for what feels like almost 2 years ago. Now the game is still under development, past its expected release date. The new big island they've been working on apears to be in beta for almost 2 months now, and It almost seems like the game is dying. As of recent I've played 7 Days to Die, which is like 20 times better in comparrisan to this survival game. Crafting is better, construction is better (because its based on a block system instead of premade structures). Survival mode is better. I just want to say that originally I was really looking forward to this game being released but now I'm not so sure. If you want to spend your money on a good survival game, buy 7d2d not this buggy garbage.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game is Early Access, and my review is based on development from time of purchase until time of review.Gameplay wise, very little has changed over the course of time. Glitches and bugs abound. There's not much content. Survival is incredibly difficult in a way that is unbalanced. It doesn't feel fun in any way whatsoever.It looks like this game has a ton of potential but the developers aren't reaching like they should be.Right now, I don't reccomend buying this game. Give it six months and check back. It's either going to get really good, or it's going to stay right here forever.

content:
Posted: January 23
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands, a game where wanna be Ewonks can spawn in your home at night whilst you're going through your inventory (which all three of the chests I made fell through the floor btw), you have to wait unit you freeze to death because you're stuck somewhere (be it a broken path, jumping on some rocks looking for coal or where ever), placement of things you want to out down is ridiculous at times, and loads very slowly on top being absurdly choppy once you finally load even with the graphics on the second best settings and lots of things turned off (though it will eventually get smoother, it tends to get choppy as you're exploring). There's not even a point to the game. Once you have the best weapons and armor and finally kill that obnoxious dragon that won't shut up as you're hunting for animals that seemingly don't respawn, then what?  Nothing, that's what. If anything this game is maybe worth $7 or $8 max. Honestly, just play Skyrim or the elder scrolls online now that there's no subscription and they've made a lot of updates if you really want to craft so bad. At least then you'll have better bows.

number of helpful: 10 of 20 people (50%) found this review helpful23 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								Beta 0.8.0 updated review:Savage Lands has really started to evolve into something special. Around the launch of the public alpha I was a bit skeptical if this would really come together into a game with staying power. I liked their refreshing take on some of the more tired survival concepts, but it felt rough on a lot of fronts and some of the mechanics were overly burdensome (like 10 hammer swings per ore drop, yeesh). The developers have really come through for us, though. Every system has had a bit of polish and a new coat of paint. The game at it's core has not changed much, but pretty much all the little annoyances and bugs have been ironed out. Movement and combat feels very good now, gathering is much more fun and engaging, FPS is significantly more stable and the post processing and general graphical look is better. With the improvements made in the last 6 months or so, I really can't wait to see where this game goes. As it is, it is worth it's sticker price for sure. It no longer feels like a beta.

Early Access Review
								I was in a bit of a bad mood over finding posts with information that had no reason to be deleted.I actually like the game but I'm still disturbed by these actions of this developer.I'm going to leave the original contents below.Sorry, censoring where to find critical files like saves != community involvement. content:
Posted: March 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has a LOT of potential. ATM its pretty fun ... but with the lack of content I can see how it will get old pretty quickly ... but even as is ... totally worth the money :)I am not sure how it would function at a 32 player game or even a PvP game ... as for it to be a PvP game it will need to rework the combat system entirely as atm it pretty much is just a hack and slash. But it is a FPS survival game with fantasy elements ... how can I ask for more!?Combat system is fun and even if it is a little bit grindy, like ALL open world survival games, I am still enjoying it and love the fact that the enemy mobs BAF and sneak up on you at times.Crafting system is fun and logical ... you can't find out how to craft things until you have the mats.Survival ... really is that. It has the best qualities of don't starve is a superior format. It needs some work as I think that crafting of food recipes would be great and also farming etc... but that may be something they will look at later and totally not needed now. Mulitplayer is capped out at 8 people ... which some people are crying over ... but seriously 8 players is a zerg in this game and you could just kill everything too easily ... will be interesting to see how they change things when they do up the server pop limit ...The map ... there isn't one ... so it's explore and mark your way ... they do have a compass which helps ... but it doesn't help you when you are dead :PMorale of the story ... I have played 1 character and I haven't died yet ... so if you have read a review of people crying about how impossible it is ... they are noob squeekers so ignore those negative reviews.Top work guys on this game thus far... was actually really surprised how good it actually was.Please keep at it and keep developing ... I mean you could totally turn this in to a game with expansion packs and larger worlds and magic and range combat and cities and siege and omg the world is your oyster ... can't wait to see my first Dragon and really looking forward to seeing some Dungeons.Only negative comment atm is that armor still needs some tweaking ... but that is just an alpha issue and wouldn't be something that should stop ANYONE from buying a game ... unless they are a squeeker and then go hack in rust or somethng.

number of helpful: 8 of 16 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								I dont normally do EA anymore since the last few years its become a method of grabbing money from customers and gamers and ripping them off, However I decided I would give this a try after researching it some, and I have to say SO FAR, I am glad I did, and as long as the developers dont stop developing this game has amazing potential and fun!!! one of the best EA survival games to date including better then H1Z1's release and cash grab. I highly recommend this game , it has some bugs yes but WELL WORTH 15 bucks, I got it on sale, and definetly will be worth 25 later. Do remeber its "pre alpha" not really "EA" unless you mean early Alpha, but the game runs great dispite a few bugs, its very hard yes, which I love , challenging is great, they need to tweak the durability of items so they dont break in one fight, right now the best armor in the game is broken in a single fight with a bear which is a quite hard fight and im glad just need to make your items not break so quickly, makes it almost impossible to keep up and in gear, the game is well worth what they are asking right now. No way to go wrong unless the developers run off and stop developing it.UPDATE 3/11/15The game is very fun, the mobs are amazing thus far, the building as far as the houses and stuff go are all just premade designs nice ones but generic.I see a lot of people complaining they cant get food, stones etc, or hunt becuase they have no weapon, these are all crys from people who are ignorant to the game and dont know how to read if they cant figure it out for themselves, you can in fact kill wolfs, deer with your fists ive done it many times and stones are EVERYWHERE, not to mention there are campsites premade and old ruins everywhere that spawn gear , food and armor.The isnt easy by any means if you are a instant gratifcation type who refuses any work to get somewhere in a game you might want to walk away from this one, its not for the timid or the rage quitters, this game naked is very easy once you figure out how everything works to survive and build up.You drop all of your gear on death, however if you learn quickly how to make respawn totems which are easy enough, you can get your gear back, but die in a unknown area good luck, I lost like 5 bodies when I first started not realizing your first make you are given some starter gear, die and respawn and you are naked.The cold enviornment in this game makes it essential to keep a campfire going or get some really decent armor made which you wont get done right away, so campfires will be your friend, especially at night, the temperature drops drasticly and is a death sentence if you dont have a campfire or at least a house with decent armor, not starter armor.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								After only 6.6 hours (unfortunately) I haven't even scratched the bottom of this game, so let's review the things I did touch.Survival mechamics,These seem solid, It's a nice mix of keeping things difficult without making it tedious, annoying or restrictive.The game could do with a thirst mechanic but the system in place is perfectly fine.Combat,For it's genre the combat is great, I haven't fiddled around with bows and shields but the two hands mechanic works very well.Since I play the game coop/friendly only I haven't encountered any pvp combat.Multiplayer,Here is where things get interesting, the server hosting mechanic works really well, not requiring port forwarding for me and having near instant connection with friends and strangers alike.Early access,The game is currently in early access it will have bugs (I lost a character once) and it patches about once or twice every month or so, so progress can be lost.However there is a neat little timer showing the time to the next patch, and I have personally never noticed it being wrong.I love the ability to play the game in early access and all the usual 'issues' with early access seem to elude this game.All in all, for me, the game works very well, it's solid, lag free and very light on bugs and issues10/??? I should play some more and see what else the game has to offer.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Alpha ReviewA survival game with a fantasy setting.Wake up on a beach with basic supplies. There are three bars to keep full. Warmth, health and hunger. Keep warm with cloths, building a fire or a house. Craft weapons and armor to fight the islands many creatures. Harvest their meat to cook in your fire for food.Many ways to collect supplies and materials. Hammers to mine stones. Hatchets to cut wood. Swords to harvest meat.There are even spawn points around the island for random items.Smooth gameplay.


YouTube™ Video: Working On My Town In Savage Lands 

			Views: 152		

			First I check the towns several item spawns. Killing anything that moves in the area. Next is gathering materials to expand the town and to craft the tools I'll need to do it.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is based on about 60 minutes of gameplay:Pros:-Has atmosphere to it! -Graphic quality is decent-Runs well, with hardly any FPS drop-As it looks, it also feel like a mixture of RUST, The Forest and Skyrim in one.-Weapon variety isn't lacking-Multiplayer functionality works fairly well with minimal lag (That also depends on your internet speed too)-Player population appears to be rising steadilyCons:-Crafting experience could be streamlined better. Like the UI is a little trashy to navigate through-Want more craftable stuff NOA! :P.. Where my fences, locks and towers brah!?

content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Based on the engine of Unity 4, this Early Acces attempt at a hybrid survival game proved to be quite entertaining with a friend at your back. Add the fact that the game has some RPG and lore elements to its progression map, it can easily be considerer a gem in the rough, especially for the satisfying price of 0.60 € . However, the bugs and choppy frame on which the game elements is set is quite broken and game breaking. All in all, it was worth the purchase price but not a positive review considering the game breaking bugs which forbid me from completing it coupled with the absence of feedback from the devs.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Been playing for around a year and all I can really say is Id like to kick everyone that gave this a good review in the nuts. This game is horrible. In every aspect. First and foremost optimization. I have a decent gaming PC that can handle Skyrim, Fallout 4, and the Witcher 3 well and this eye diarrhea plays like crap even on low settings (and it looks REALLY bad). The Dev's update regularly but seems like you would want to make the game balanced and playable before you keep adding more meaningless stuff. Yes they updated to Unity 5.3 which provides a slight graphical ehnacement but thats about it. I hate complaining about early access but this game is just horrible and I see no amount of time that can improve it if it has progressed this slowly in a year.  Plus I was sorely dissapointed by the building. Most other games allow you to somewhat customize how you build your home. Not this game, cookie cutter house designs mean your home will always look the same. Plus the insane amount of resources required to build anything pretty much kills the single player experience. Unless you like mindless clicking on trees and rocks for hours just to build a bland looking house. I'll pass, you should too.
