number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								(First week of Early Access) This game has great potential and the devs are very active on both the forums and the development of the game. They have a nice interaction with the community and they do livestreams each thursday where they answer some questions about the game.  Now I was lucky since I received the game with a giveaway that the developers did on their stream. However after playing the game I sure feel like if I had payed for it I wouldn't regret it. In the very first early release I had about 4 hours of gameplay. However due to some annoying things like armor decaying quickly and not being able to relight campfires, I had to stop playing untill next patch. When I checked the forums I was delighted by a post by the devs that specified the changes in the next patch. In this patch, once the most annoying things are fixed, the game will be even more playable. New features will also come after bugs are killed. The developers are gamers themselves and I trust in them in this age of scamming developers and lazy money grabber companies. They constantly check the steam forums and take user feedback into account. Anyway enough of praising, this game itself has a lot of potential. It has skeletons, giant walking trees, huge bears, scary wolves and a dragon which at the moment is of no threat but later on according to the devs the dragon will be a part of something big in the game along with magic. Night times are scary and hard. At nights there are scary lurkers and the cold is an even bigger threat than it is in the morning. I would say the game is hard at first but once you get the hang of things like crafting,looting and surviving it becomes easier. Right now there is no pvp in the game, but surely it will come. Some kind of magic is hinted at and will surely come sooner or later. So yes I do recommend this game. Have a good day.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								I know this is an early release. But I can see what they are trying to do and where they are going. The only reason I can recommend this game is if you like to hit your thumb with a hammer so it feels good when you stop. You are left stranded on a deserted (sort of) island. You begin to gather supplies. You soon find out however that in order to get these supplies you will run out of the ones you need trying to get the others. I've played four or five games and have yet to survive a night. No save option? In 2015! Most people like a save option, for those who don't put a hardcore option in. After banging my head against this game a few times I've had enough.  To light a fire you need six stones... (really? are the rangers going to arrest you for not having a ring around your fire?) a flint, and a log. Apparently logs light w/o the use of tinder... in the snow... from a freshly cut tree. Once you get a fire going it's not enough to gather some wood and toss a log on it once in awhile. You have to let it go out and start with a new flint and log. The whole game is an excercise in futility.  Save your money. Play Skyrim. It's more fun and doesn't punish you for playing. Btw, when you die, you respawn back on the coast with none of your items to be found. You are this time left with only a loincloth. Wow, fun, fun, fun.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								It's a really good concept, but for now it's lacking tremendously in content. I would suggest waiting off until it gets a bit more meat on it's bones.Obviously, from only having 2 hours on the game, I really can't speak for the entire game. What I do know is that the beginning is a kinda lack-luster. I LOVE the first little check-list system, and I think that most survival games could learn a lot from that. It's a near perfect way to implement a tutorial. However, past that, I found the gameplay had little variety (atleast in the beginning). I would have loved to have seen more animals, and more variety in the weapons. I like the idea of freezing, however I never felt very threatened by it.My main gripe, and I know it's not the best gripe, is the lack of a way to skip the night through sleeping. Each night I found myself just sitting in my little shack waiting for the sun to rise. I was completely safe, and therefore I feel as though I shouldn't have had to wait.I realize this is a very early release of the game, however, it's priced as something that's completely finished, therefore I feel as though it should be more of a complete package. I commend the developers on responding to my review, and I will certainly be following the developement of this game.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								Bought it today via the humblebundle.. Aint even worth the 90 cents.The crafting system is absolutely horrendous. There is no searchfunction. Plus, if you wanna craft a bandage, for example, you cant just click on it if you have cotton, no you have to manually click on the cloth scraps, craft those, then craft the bandage. And this just continues to be even worse the more complex it gets. I have 10/20 achievements already after 2 hrs of play with no knowledge of the game whatsoever. You can equip 10 bags at once, makes the inventory just more of a mess.The whole UI is ♥♥♥♥ed up as well. Combat is superboring, you have 1 Attack. Thats it. Animationquality is also bad, music is basically nonexistent.No story, nothing else to do, cant interact with most of the world.Gathering resources is terrible.Dont buy this if you are looking for a good survival game. There are better ones out there.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								I actually like this game, but do not reccomend (without warning) because its advertised as a survival game, and this is NOT a survival game.  I've only recently started playing survial games, having only played two other games billed as survival games and Savage Lands differes from them in two major ways:  One is there is no death penalty.  In a survival game, if you die, the game is over (install a "hardcore mode").  Second is that in Savage Lands, merely surviving is very easy.  Its way too simple, in fact.  Not sure how to fix that.Thats my reccomendation, now for the Devs, a few thoughts:Things roll downhill, its cute, but annoying and not realistic.Durability is an issue, I'm killing things all day long just to keep my gear repaired.You should be able to break down found gear.Buildings should have more purpose.  For survival, the only one you ever want to spend the time on is the smithy.  The rest are for town simming fun.Days seem too long, and you can't sleep through the night.  I'm eating several dear or wolves per day.  Not that there is a lack of meat, I have stacks of it because my equipment needs the more important animal product, sinew for daily repairs.Encumberance should be included. You shouldn't be able to carry the world with you in 8 backpacks.Bandages are an issue, I'm exploring the map desperatly trying to make it from one cotton plant to another.  (in areas with the BIG wolves).Rocks should disappear when they are mined out... unless they eventually regenerate?Could not "place" the pine chest in the smithy, I just kind of dropped it and there it sits, immovable.Look forward to playing and seeing the additions you guys come up with.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Has potential, but i do not recommend it at the current point in time. Graphics are not awful. Movement and control is a bit wonky still. My character was stuck on a tiny rock. I found a tower and couldn't climb in the debris, collision wise it was a full cylinder with stairs on the outside, but visually it had gaping holes and voids i thought might contain some loot. There isn't much within the world that i could find. I beelined it right inland and saw tiny wolves, and stags more than anything. I saw 2 skeletons that were dispatched with ease and maybe 4 bigger wolves. The item list looks impressive but i would need to look into it further for all of that. So far it honestly seems rather cakewalkish, i killed everything i saw with minimal trouble amd without crafting anything. It just felt really empty. I am looking forward to what this might turn into, please don't abandon this devs.Update 22.12.2015Played online with some people from all over the world. Stil don't recommend it, much of the grind was brought down by us working together, despite little to no shared language. It was interesting, but still not something I can recommend right now. Devs, if you want to talk to me on my review, feel free to leave your comments. Deleting them just sets bad vibes.

ALT + F4, SELF-INDUCED SUICIDE, OR FIND SOMETHING ELSE TO KILL YOU FIRST!! THESE BEASTS ARE ♥♥♥♥ING SAVAGES AND WILL MAKE YO' BED--- YO' DEATH BED!!!!!       This game is amazing, I've only played it for several hours and can already tell it has potential. The pre-game is probably the roughest point a player has to overcome throughout the entire game, with limited resources and several survival factors such as Warmth, Hunger, and Health; this game isn't for the average COD scrub. Although the combat system can be easily abused by circling enemies and spamming left mouse, it shows promise with future updates. I found this game realitively easy, until you find a Plague Wolf... then you spend the next half hour trying to kill it with your bare fists because it guards yo stuff better than a Watchdog Security System, this game will beat you to your knees, and leave you with nothing, but some stone and frostberries. "9/10 would get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by Plague Wolf Again."  Also fix the snow/fog/mist from going through the ceiling bug, it really kills the little feeling of safety you get from camping in a village's townhall...

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Not enjoyable yet. This WILL be a great game, but as it stands right now it can be quite frustrating. It's much too hard to gather resources. Weapons/Tools break way too fast.  And while you might be able to fight off the cold nights later on, getting to that point is a huge task that can end up being very frustrating. Devs: You need to add more ways to get resources.  Stone, wood, sticks, and more sources of food. I had no idea what I was doing my first time playing, so I got stone and wood gathered to make a fire.  I regretted this short after, as fire's burn out fast, and stone is almost non-existant without a hammer (which you need stone to make) and wood is non-existant without an axe (Which also requires stone....). Realisticly you'd be able to pry some sticks off a tree, and find some small rocks around the other boulders we see... Neither of these traits are true in the game yet. A few adjustments to balance out how the game starts could do this game wonders.  I'm all for challenging games, i'm not asking for an Easy button.  I do like the severity of the weather, how hard enemies hit, bleeding, disease, etc.  That's all good.  But this needs to be balanced out more. We can't enjoy all the challenges you have set up for us, if we can't even survive the first night. I've only played singleplayer as of now, as I don't have anyone else to play this with. All that im griping about might be alleviated in the multiplayer side of the game, but you've got to make the game playable on SP too.Don't misunderstand: This is a great game here. It has great features now, and they will clearly get better.  But it's too hard to enjoy those features right now. It just needs a simple re-balance, and the whole experience will improve 10x over.  EDIT: Changing to recommended, sheerly because a Dev actually replied and appreciated the feedback.  That indicates to me that whatever we find wrong with the game and talk about, the devs are going to listen and make appropriate changes.  That's a rare thing these days.  And that means this game will get the fixes it needs and turn into an outstanding game.

content:

Early Access Review
								As much as i am playing this game as player Stormheim i am in regards giving this game a negative review for the following, not because of the game devs fualt but for the reasons that will be listed down below. Thank you.For one this game is still early access and is still in a constant working build wich players have to understand. we live in a♥♥♥♥♥♥age where people see an early access and twant it to be instantly done and thats not how it works at all and players need to understand that. i my self played savage lands from the very begining whe it was in an alpha mode and had one island then took a couple years break then came back to enjoy what was recently implamented and came across some funny / awesome players who shared the same things in common such as i. though i will continue to play the game and see how it goes. it does lack on going immersion to keep the intentiveness of the game to be apeasing though that being a small factor it could be worked on more to keep the game feeling more alive. yes there are bugs and those bugs are being worked on which is good. How ever, moving onto the servers. friendly is fine and most obvious if you dont want to play on hostile. ( such is fine for making the most obvious statement) but if your like me and want to do pvp once in a while then you're gonna want to give into that itch of combat. how ever hostile servers arent the problem. The problem is what players are doing within those hostile servers. if you collected and upgraded your guys to such a point where he can no longer be further upgraded and you go into a hostile server thinking you're ok sadly you are wrong. players have cheapen the game expierence and what i believe will kill hostile servers before hostile servers can count or serve their official purpose upon official release. what players are doing are making walls or fence traps around where you spawn and cannot escape and killing and ganking other unsuspecting players and stealing their gear and everything they worked for with out remorse and consequence in this early build. it is themost scummiest thing i havent come across in a long time. These type of hostile servers and players are what will kill the game if the devs do not act fast upon the issue and i fear if this type of non sense were to continue savage lands wont last long as a long time game to stand on its own because of such and will forever be in a constant state of friendly " PC " land of happiness and friendliess then quick to mad boredom beyond measure. It's easy to say " well dont go on hostile servers " yeah no ♥♥♥♥ing♥♥♥♥♥♥retard. thanks for stating the obvious ♥♥♥♥face. This is not the point i am getting at. the point im getting at is that hostile servers should serve pvp in its original format meaning players dont get spawn killed where they spawn and should be free to go around n find what they can just so they can properly pvp n battle against. not joina  serve only to find them selves instantly die ina  spawn trap and cant escape it because they are being spawn camped time and time again. This is whats called common sense in seperating the issue's. Like i stated before, i will continue to play this game because i enjoy playing with the people i became friends with over time because we make the game fun and intrieging and will keep continueing to post and give screen shots to the devs and will not stop until something is implamented to prevent such spawn trapping and player spawn ganking. `Thank you for taking the time to read this -Stormheim. Also if you plan to try this game, atleast get the game ona  bundle or ona  discount n see how you like it for your self to see if you want to hop in on the expierence before you let steam reviews decide the game for you. This review is to just give an over all statement on whats going on and what you can be on the look out for thats happening in the game.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pretty much your generic modern survival game à la Rust and Ark: Survival Evolved. This game's unique spin on the formula is that the enemies are harder to defeat (Along with a pleasing fantasy aesthetic). The problem with this is that the combat system is the same hold down left click to vaguely flail at things in front of you system of this game's influences, meaning that the actual skill in the harder combat feels like is still exactly the same. I did go in to this game after reading many reviews praising the game greatly, which may have given me some unfair expectations, but all in all I left the game unsatisfied.Otherwise it seems like a pretty solid addition to the survival genre, but if you aren't already sold on these games this will certainly not change your mind.

								Ok here we go.I got this game as a part of the humblebundle and I thought: "well why not - give it a shot"survival - openworld - craft - medieval - coop stuff .... mhh ok there are quite a few of those games.-----------Negativ critic-----------------Worst first: It's damn ugly.I got to say, the game does not look good at all. I tried with the highest settings and everything but still. The World, the textures and even the animations are ugly. And even beeing that ugly, it still does not perform very well. Frame drops and lagsthroughout the game (especially multiplayer).And that's the biggest minus to this game for my opinion.The other point is the menues and the crafting system.It's clunky, it's confusing and like the rest of the game: ugly.The lack of a search option for anything you want to craft or the simple option to scroll with your mousewheel in the menues just makes it annoying to navigate through them.------------------------------------------After a little while fiddling around I at least understood the craftig system, what to get,where to combine and what to build.++++++++Positiv critic+++++++++++A little plus to the game had to be said aswell.I like the world.- Besides the unpleasing cold and snowy setting I really enjoyed exploringthe map and against all odds, the map is pretty big and full of little areas you want to take a look at. I also like, that you have what looks like a "endgame-content" which is something to lookup to.At the first little exploration on the map you'll see this (SPOILER) dragon creature flying around and you instantly think - I'm gonna kill that guy -And that's not as easy as it first looks :) So you have something to work for in this openworld.+++++++++++++++++++++++++++So the game-content is ok-ish I would say BUT!!! And here comes the main reason for mythumb-down review:The ugliness of this game, beeing it the poor graphics, the messy and user-unfriendly interfaces or the clunky animations completly outweights the positiv aspects of the game and ruining theexperience and the long-run activity.So thats a pretty clear NO from my side, at the actual state of this early access game.::Take care.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Let me start by saying that this game has huge potential, and I want to recommend it, I really do.Savage Lands is an incredible concept on paper, and drew me in straight away, even with some bad reviews. The problem with Savage Lands is that the performance is absolutely awful. I spent over an hour making the game run and then getting into a local game as there are no dedicated servers. When I finally got into the game (which took over twenty minutes) I was plagued with performance issues. I turned my settings right down and still had performance problems, and I'm well within recommended specifications as well as not having software problems. To be sure that the issue wasn't my own I asked around and found that performance issues are definitely a big problem. As someone with experience in game development, I could see a lot of good reviews popping up if we had a slider for draw distance (good for lower spec), some work on performance before adding new features and consideration of renting dedicated servers to players. Frankly, the menu UI is ugly and needs an overhaul. All of that being said I will definitely be coming back to the game after a few patches because I'd really like to see how it develops. I won't be refunding as I recieved the game through Humble Bundle. To sum this all up, I would not recommend buying the game right now, but I would recommend watching how it develops and considering a purchase in future.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game WAS fun, in the alpha.Once beta hit the building mechanics all changed and basically changed the game alltogether.There is a wide gap in difficulty level.  When you first start it is IMPOSSIBLE to collect materials for even basic weapons and shelter.  Once you've progressed far enough, there isn't anything left to do.  It's far too easy.I was very hopefull for this. It was a survival game with fantasy aspects and this was something new.In order for this game to be successfull:*Revamp the entire building system, or revert it back to alpha*Give the game a goal/purpose other than pure survival. I realize this is unheard of in survival games where the goal is simply that, surviving.  However, this is a "fantasy" survival and this genre needs more quest-style play to succeed. OR*PVP- this is how survival games survive.  This game however has such a strong PvE focus that the PvP is nearly non-existant.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game has potential. I played about 7 hours. I enjoyed crafting and the gathering was alright.There was a huge power gap between island 1 and 2. I mined all the best meterials I could and build the best items I could before I moved on to the next area. The monsters were ok to fight but they could easily one shot me which made me wonder why I worked so hard to make this armor. All of those little bugs and balancing aside I stopped playing after my fourth death due to being stuck in terrain. I'd like to return to this game a few months down the line and see if it is fixed but for nowe I can not recomend it. If you can get it cheap pick it up as it is wortha few hours of fun and the potential for it to get better is definitely there. My advice for the devs is to make losing items on respawn a tickable option so people can prevent it when exploring before official release. At least until the game is balanced and the clipping is fixed. I'd also supress mob spawns in a radiaus around respawn points.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tried it and sadly didn't like - I had high expectations for it, admitedly, so I shall now wait for it to be more updated before trying again (I'll be honest I buy very few pre-release games for this reason now).Now yes I agree reviews from those who spent less than 2 hours in game isn't as valid as those with 100 hours.. So I won't even try to comment on most of the gameplay that I did/did not like.The graphics are okay, and the environment is varied well enough. You don't come across the same building simply repainted 18 quintillion times (unlike some rather expensive games as of late) which is imo very important for a survival game like this where exploration is key. So for that - I like this game!Unfortunately, I found the UI and some other aspects horrendous to use, very clunky and certain aspects counter intuitive. The crafting system was also a little of the mark for my liking and somewhat counter intuitive - I felt like it was trying to fight against me whilst using it..Combat was 'okay', although even after an hour I wasn't liking where it was going, I felt like I was going to be doing pretty much the same thing for however long I played with regards to attacks.Unfortunately for me the worst part about the game in current state are the sound affects. These were very similar from one task to the next, and even after 5 minutes I was scratching the edge of my mouse for it to stop. I do think it worthwhile pointing out that I am a big fan of good music and sound affects, so I guess this was probably the reason I disliked it quite so much.I very much wanted to like this game, but, I think I'll find myself waiting for more updates/full release before I try this again - It's got a lot of potential so I'd FOLLOW this and see where it goes in the future. 3/10 in current state from me.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								The grapgics are amazing, and I love the concept. It's not a bad game by any means, so don't get me wrong, i'm going to rant a bit. .My main issue with they game is that it seems to be made unreasonably hard on purpose. And of course it's a survival game about being stranded alone with little to no supplies, so it should be hard. But I mean this is unrealistically so. For example one of the first things that you need to do is build a fire so you do not freeze to death. To build a fire you need 6 stones for the fire pit, 3 logs, and some flint. Flint is easy enough to find. But somehow, for some unfathomable reason, with miles upon miles of open beach, forest, and hills, cliffs, and giant rock outcroppings, it's nearly impossible to find a few stones or logs. I was able to find 1 log relatively easily, but it's floating about 500 yards out in the freezing water, and if you go get it, you will die of hypothermia before you find any more to make a fire. A work around for the log problem is to find a stick (different from a log, and harder to find), and use a stone with that to make a hatchet. But it's already so hard to find a stone that doing so feels like a huge sacrifice. The only reason I can think of why simple stones and logs would be so scarce in a wilderness/beach environment is that the entire map, the beach, the trees, the rock outcroppings all over the beach, etc, is made of plastic.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you like fantasy sandbox games, Savage Lands is definitely worth a look. Rather than reiterating all of the good aspects mentioned here in reviews, I'll focus on what I don't like about this game:ITEM DURABILITY, UGH!!!!!!!In around a 3-4 hour play session, I have to replace some of my armor and weapons multiple times. It feels like that this is the core gameplay loop. You craft armor and weapons only to craft more armor and weapons... constantly. I found it difficult to build up a cache of wearable items, because my weapons and armor would degrade faster than I could create them.I still recommend this game, but item durability needs some serious tweaks, or a system to repair items.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								I was excited to try this out as I bought it in the humble bundle. At first it started out fairly fun. The graphics aren't amazing but that personally doesn't bother me. From the start I noticed it doesn't really tell you much. Thankfully I've played prior survival games, which I'm sure was a huge help and kept me from being completely lost. However, as I played a bit more, I realized the only thing I was doing was running around looking for food, constantly. All of the animals (rabbits, deer, boar etc) became next to impossible to find, so I starved to death. Multiple times. There was nothing to forage for food. No berries, apples, nothing. Doing nothing but running around looking for food while starving to death is not what I would call fun. You can make rabbit traps but that costs resources which was made very, very difficult by the constantly starving to death part. Even if you do manage to craft one, rabbits aren't caught often enough to keep you alive.Also, it lagged. A LOT. Not all the time, but when it did.... it was bad.I do no recommend the game as it currently is. While it feels like it *could* be fun if some things were changed, in its current state I can't.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is the closest thing to a simple multiplayer Skyrim we will probably get anytime soon.  The landscape reminds me a lot of Skyrim, plus there is a fairly good crafting system.  Your main enemies are cold and hunger.  It basically feels like you're shipwrecked on a land where a big battle or catastrophe has occurred and you are the only people left.  There are lots of creatures though.Survival is hard but very doable at the present.  There is a lot of unfinished content like chests (or almost everything) in buildings that you can't interact with.  Also there is no magic system, quest system, or anything like that.  Basically you hunt, fight monsters (and scavenge skins, meat, teeth, etc. from the remains), gather materials (like coal, flint, wood, stone, and different types of ore), build better armor/weapons and survival structures, and explore.  There really is no storyline that I can tell, just a little bit of lore found in notes and books.  I haven't seen any NPCs yet.  I've played it co-op with another player for 10+ hours now and we are still interested and pushing ahead while building forward camps to see what else we can find.

content:
Posted: April 10
Early Access Review
								This is not a real hardcore review, because game still in early access, just wanna mention few things because Im not sure this game really deserve so many negative assessments:1) As said before, this is still an EA game, and buying such games always a lottery. Bugs and broken gameplay is a quite common problem of a survival\sandbox genre, when after some development point game become partly or fully unplayable for a few or many players. Just check reviews of '7Days to Die', 'Space Engineers' or other popular games of that genre, youll find same problems.Personally I prefer not to buy EA games anymore because of a huge risks, but I got Savage lands long time ago for a less than 5€ and for this sum I got more than enough. At least I got much more entertainment than from 'Castle Miner Z' or 'District' so I really cant blame devs for a mistakes that were done after moving game from Unity4 on Unity 5.Savage lands quite good for a few hours of solo gameplay, not bad (at least hilarious) for a coop seccions, whats more important, you still can play old, much more stable version made on u4 by checking BETA option in game settings. I highly recommend to stay on older build because even its much more simple, its much more enjoyable.Wont widely list all good and bad sides of this game, just wanna say that summarising good core mechanics and gameplay, overall ambient, quality graphics, and stable multiplayer with infestation by small bugs, quite empty world and small craftlist (plus way more awful bugs in u5 version of game) I still enjoy u4 build of this game and still think that its worth a try with 75% discount.Just a few days ago devs post a message in SC that game still in development so I hope it wont die like 'Towns' or 'Spacebase DF-9'.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								(TL;DR at bottom.)[I am open to changing this review once (and if) the game improves.]This is a weird case for me, I want to like this game, and as such, would consider being on the fence. But not this one. While I do say, YES, it certainly has potential. As is? NO, I can not recommend Savage Lands to you or anybody else.I played it sometime last year, and liked it for the most part. I just now came back to it, and quite a bit has SEEMED to change, and while, yes, it has, it has not been for the better. The game was already living up to its name before, this is a brutal game; you don't even need to make a mistake for it to punish you. But there-in lies the issue. The game, seems to have been made EVEN HARDER than the last time I played it.I spawned, killed a skeleton with a stick, okay. Try to gather supplies before night, okay. The moment night falls, WOLVES. WOLVES WOLVES WOLVES. Your starting weapon does nothing. Your fists do nothing. You're forced to run, and if you're lucky, you'll get away. Alone, naked and cold, unless you somehow managed to scrap together clothing by day 1 (which won't be enough), or miraculously found enough (and managed to carry it with you) materials to build another fire, you'll freeze to death before morning. The water might as well be LAVA with how quickly it ends your life if you dare so much as wade up to your waist into it. Because yes, cold now consumes your life in the opposite direction. That is now health you no longer have access to. Even if you manage to warm up, that health will be missing! So if you so much as get a little chilly, you'll get one-shot before you have time to see that second skeleton, that wolf, or a giant boar.Now, I'm not one who complains about difficulty in a game. But I am one to complain about PERFORMANCE of a game. They have gone out of their way in the last year I played this, to drive this to unfair and un-fun levels of 'hard', yet they have done NOTHING to improve the game's actual stability. Combat is still  ungodly clunky , and even on the lowest settings, the random lag, slow-downs, or outright freezes, will most likely kill your fun before the nightly spawn-rates do.TL;DR: If the game would perform better and had less clunky combat, it'd be cool.

content:
Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								Definitely not in a state ready to be bought. I played up to the second island and that's a pretty good way into the game.  First off, the quality of the enemies AI varies WILDLY from enemy to enemy.  I haven't seen any that I'd call good, but I have seen some truly terrible ones.  The early game skeletons can be completely dodged without any difficulty.  whether they even notice the player is random.  The first boss, "kruul" has no AI.  He literally stands there and lets the player hit him as much as they want.  If you are LUCKY he might hit back once.  Even then I'm pretty sure I remember dodging it.  The higher level monsters have sketchy AI.  They are okay in that they'll usually land a hit on occasion, but often they have some silly trick to get them stuck in a wall or on a pebble somewhere.  At which point you can usually wail on them as much as you want.  The lore in the game is half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥  As in the developers have been changing the way the game works and they haven't been matching the lore up to match it.  If anyone is wondering where the portal that all the papers mention in the game over and over again, it's a bridge now....  That's right, documents and walkthroughs posted online all mention a portal to the second island, but it's not a portal anymore, it's a freaking bridge as of this review.  Now the reason I quit playing.  It's because I got one-shotted on the second island where the monsters are DRAMATICALLY stronger than on the first island.  Then I got♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off when the stupid monster was guarding my corpse.  Let me make this clear, I didn't die where the monster spawned, the monster ran after me and guarded where he killed me so I couldn't get my corpse unless I lured him away, died a second time, then got my corpse....That brings me to another complaint.  The power difference of the monsters on the first island and the second island is RIDICULOUS....  I played the first island to DEATH gaining every possible advantage I could reap from it and I'm still getting one-shotted by boss monsters found in the second island. I had full tin armor which is as high as the first island allows.  Some of the normal monsters there are also ridiculous.  If the ghoul lands his poison, you'll be on deaths door in a matter of seconds. Make bloody sure you have the anti-poison powder ready because you won't last long otherwise.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game back in 2015, gave up after a while as the game was stacked against the player.  I have kept coming back  over the last year and after the last update I have been playing daily.  This is may favourite build, the mobs in game are now more realistically difficult, most can be defeated  with right gear, but some will do u with one hit, but using bow from distance u can knock down their HP before attacking with melee. I like the idea of being able to destroy structures to gain mats to rebuild buildings.  This game is early access and yes has room for improvment, hunger level needs to be changed, falls too fast when at rest, which the devs seem to be doing, i believe when finished this will be an excellent game.  I have played many so called survival games, in Savage Lands you have to work at surviving, its a frozen, bitter cold land, explore without correct equipment and end up in snow storm, cant complain if u freeze to death.  £10 is a very fair price.

content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Alright, look. I try to give games a fair review and at least play them for a decent amount of time so I can get a full understanding of the game. However, within the first 15 minutes of gameplay, I could tell that this was not a good game.First off, the framerate issues are massive. Keep in mind that I'm running Windows 10 on a more-than-decent laptop. I can run games like Skyrim and Fallout 4 with no framerate issues, but with Savage Lands it's a whole story on it's own. I even put the settings to the lowest, yet still had issues with it.Most of the characters look bland and ridiculous. Especially the skeletons.Another factor would be the controls. When you first start off, for me at least, slightly moving my mouse in any direction would force my character to swing their neck about a mile in that direction. I'm pretty sure he has whiplash now. I set the sensitivity to the lowest it could possibly be, yet it was still extremely high.The game COULD be worth it, maybe if it was free. But no. It's $15. FIFTEEN. DOLLARS. I wouldn't be ranting so hard if Savage Lands was free. Side Note: My friend gifted it to me so we could play it together but we tried to refund it. Can't refund mine. Gotta be reminded of this daily now.

content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								I bought this game during the Summer Sale, so it was at a pretty good discount. It's still in early access at the time of this writing. I'm giving it a "thumbs up" and I'm not sure why.Essentially, this is Minecraft that looks like Skyrim. I guess I like it because those are two of my favorite games.It is buggy. I've dropped items on the ground, only to have them disappear. I've had old corpses of mine reappear, effectively duping all my gear. I've seen items floating in mid-air that should be on the ground. For two weeks, a dragon came and breathed fire on me every time I came outside -- in the newb zone.But, I take all of that with a grain of salt. It is in early access. The devs are pushing out new builds every few weeks. They are still making big changes to the content. It looks great and has a lot of potential. I'm eager to see where they take it.

Early Access Review
								Wanted to write a review because I see the game got plenty of negative reviews and I don't believe the game deserves them. Before I start I got to say that I got the game from a friend within the humble bundle - can't say anything about the game before that period.Does the game has some bugs that are quite annoying? Yes. Should some features be added/changed/fixed/revamped? Yes ... and that is normal and expected when you get an Early Access game. One thing that this game has and many does not is the great communication between the community and the developers that results in creation of a better game. You can actually find out what are devs working on and influence their decision on future development of the game. Game updates comes every two - three weeks that fixes/adds lots of things. About the game itself. The game is fun and challenging, it's like a survival version of Skyrim (just without NPC's). It has rich contend and the game is only in early access so I would say that the game has immense potencial. Can't wait to see how the game will develop. Should you get the game for 14.99€? I would say go for it if you dont mind bugs and problems since it is in Early Access.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Savage Lands isn't a phenomenal game, but it is a competent survival game. It isn't like other sandbox survivals in that it has much more lore, sort of unique enemies and a general goal. It is an overall enjoyable experience even if it lacks some polish. Here's a pro-con list, because they're easy.Pros+just-right map. The map feels neither too large nor too small. Dangerous enough to make you think twice about certain trips, but not enough to feel unfair.+Difficulty. A lot of people used to complain about this but there is no permadeath or character progression. Death only makes you lose items which can be recovered. So while it may be difficult, it isn't too punishing.+multiplayer. I haven't played multiplayer yet but it is a great and common addition to survival games. With the small map and more goal-oriented gameplay I can imagine it would be fun with a group of cooperative friends.+Interactive and active developers. This is an early access game, and many early access games have developers that avoid the community or give up on the game or let development come to a standstill. This game has none of those problems.+Base building. Though the base building is in it's early stages and has an admittedly small amount of structures, it is a fun part of the game.neutral~Crafting. Crafting is a mixed bag. It suffers from the same issue that games like Unturned (in the 2.0 era) suffered, and that is a complicated multi-level crafting system. For example, if you want to make bronze armor you need to first craft hardened leather armor, which requires leather armor and a few other items. You also need bronze, which requires tin and copper ingots which requires tin and copper ore. You also need various small things like bronze rivets and nails which require more bronze. So the crafting can take a while and some effort to make your way through the levels, getting more complicated as the items get better and also requiring higher tier crafting, smelting and forge structures, and while some of the complexity is annoying, it isn't a terrible system. I would say just remove some of the clutter items like rivets and it would be a good system.~Combat. This game is more combat oriented than other survival games might be, with enemies spawning almost everywhere, which is a bit of a shame because the combat is mediocre. The game has various weapon types bu they all have long clunky animations and they leave you guessing as to their range, maybe you can hit that enemy 6 feet away, maybe not the animations are too poor to give any indicator. The enemies have the same style of fighting as well, but that's a good thing, they telegraph their swings giving good time to react, dodge and counter. This gives the game an unpolished, indie, pseudo-Dark Souls feel to it's combat.Cons-bugs. Currently the game has a few bugs, nothing game breaking except maybe the one that causes no enemies to spawn on the second island. Hopefully the developers can sort that one out, but overall I find the game to be relatively bug-free.-Performance. The game doesn't run all that great. Nothing new for indie early access survival titles but it would be nice to see some better optimization.-variety. There isn't all that much variety in the game. It feels as though there's three stages (corresponding with the three islands, which might be a design choice), beginner where you're just running around in the beginning trying not to die and scraping up various crap you find, intermediate where you have a small base and you collect nice ores and craft a suite of tools and armor, and the final stage where you're fighting giants and dragons and working with the highest tier armor. But it feels like the high-tier armor and weapons are only marginally better than the mid-tier stuff, and you really only end up crafting 2 sets of armor through pretty much the whole game. It would be nice if the higher tiers of armor had a less marginal increase of stats and perhaps a minecraft-esque system of "to mine gold you need iron, to get iron you need stone" to facilitate working your way up the levels.A fun, if flawed, game that could use some improvement, but is ultimately enjoyable. And if you get it for cheap on Humblebundle, it is absolutely worth it.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								For an Early Access Game, this game is acutally pretty fun.  After about 8 hours of playing, and dozens on a buddies account, I only encountered 1 bug (couldn't loot a Boar that died right next to his buddy) but it wasn't game breaking.  I never totally felt at ease while mining, hunting or even finding out how to make a campfire.  This game differently needs a buddy to team up with, so there is multiplayer for that, and single players for whom like it rough. *wink wink*  Overall, I really like this game, and with regular updates that they developers tell you about (not like DayZ....screw that game) they acutally make the game more enjoyable, rather than breaking it.  If Skyrim, Minecraft and Rust all had a baby..... Savage Lands would be that wayward ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ son.

Early Access Review
								This game is great and has great potential. I would describe it as a sort of Skyrim meets Minecraft with the gritiness of Dark Souls. Early development is a bit apparent in a lot of aspects such as combat and respawn mechanics but overall, this game is very enjoyable. My friend and I played when he got the game and the session connection was quick and seamless. We had tons of fun exploring and getting wrecked by giants.If you ever wished you could just run around a world similar to Skyrim but co-op with your friends to take down monsters and explore, then I would definitely recommend checking this game out. I will certainly be tracking this game's development and am continuing to enjoy it over 27 hours of gameplay later.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								A solid few hours into the game with some friends and so far so good. The game needs work in areas like combat an AI but the setting is good. I would suggest making more enemies with more players on a server, also the animal spawns are erratic; sometimes they are everywhere and sometimes you starve becuase you cant find a living thing. I like the crafting system but mining takes a while. The best part of this game is exploring. You are kept on your toes with keeping an eye on your hunger as well as how cold you get, while getting into scraps with the local monsters. I would advise adding some other monsters to keep this intersting; pack hunters, dangerouse flora and things that only come out at night all add to solid survival titles. As long as the AI is good. I love good AI but the creatures in this game do feel predictable and mechanical. I would recommend this game  and rate around 6 out of 10. Good if you get it cheap like in a humble bundal. Lots of potential here but it does feel like an early access game (as it is, duh).

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Got this game in a Humble Bundle. At first I was like, oh, it's the exact same game as Hurtworld, right?It's not, and in my opinion it is far better (although I haven't near completed either game).My very first impression was a positive one, the simple fact that you got to choose in the main menu whether you wanted to play locally by yourself, play online on a public server or create a server yourself. In other survival games I've found that a lot of the time, it's a dragged out pain in the♥♥♥♥♥to create your own server. Not in this one. So that's a big plus.It took me a while to figure out how to get anywhere with the simple hatchet you are provided at the start of the game, but once you figured one thing out, you had already figured ten more things out. Easy to learn, and if you don't know how to craft a certain material for example, all you really have to do is click around in the craft menu, rather than tab out and google for help. So that's another thing that makes the game easy to navigate.But I definitely wouldn't say the game is too easy. So far I've only really focused on making a nice base camp for myself, building houses and such (simply because that's the part I find most fun), but even that isn't so easy you pay no mind to it. You still have to go out in the landscape and get materials, create a smelter, use it to create more materials, use the materials to create a forge, use the forge to create MORE materials to build a house, etc. etc.It's a real step-by-step experience that I find very fun and interesting.And for people who aren't into the whole crafting thing; there are multiple dragon towers literally within sight from the spawn location. And also on your way over there you will be attacked by boars and skeletons. So yeah, if fighting is more what you're into, that's not a problem. After all, it is a survival game, not a build-a-village game.Also, you can run around with your♥♥♥♥♥♥♥hanging out. A feature I believe a lot of people will find hilarious when playing with a group of friends.Overall, I really like this game. The character creation... How do I say this politely... Has room for improvement. But even I, someone who usually doesn't even consider playing a game unless the character creation is BOMB, has managed to get over it and not let it affect the gameplay (I mean you hardly ever see yourself anyway).So if you're considering buying this, but changing your mind over the CC, don't worry, it's not gonna bother you at all. Take it from me, I usually spend 4+ hours modifying my characters' appearance. Because I'm a superficial ♥♥♥♥♥.tl;dr - Environments are nice, weather and lighting are bomb, crafting is bomb, enemies can sometimes be buggy but will still kill you, you never get bored, it's more fun than it seems the first hour or two of gameplay so give it a chance.8.6/10

Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								The dragon no longer plunders you in spawn which is great and the initial spawn area from my experience is very safe with some skeletons but nothing a spear can't handle. However the food is difficult sometimes and starvation may occur :p  but I enjoy the crafting, building, etc and hoping for more building options in the future.11/10 would starve to death again.
